genius_description:
“34+35” is the second track and second single from Ariana Grande’s sixth studio album positions.

The title is a mathematical expression that is equivalent to 69, which is the name of a sexual position referenced by the lust-themed song. This also acts as a play on the album’s and its lead single’s title.

In this song, Ariana sings about having a large sex drive and intending to have intercourse with her partner “all night long.”

An official remix was released on January 15, 2021, with new contributions from singer/rapper Doja Cat, and rapper Megan Thee Stallion.
genius_annotations:
[('Math class
 Never was good', [['Ariana jokingly ends the song with the fact that she sucks at math, undermining the sexual bravado in the majority of the song.

However, she tweeted in 2010 that she actually likes math class (perhaps sarcastically).

https://twitter.com/ArianaGrande/status/8911319286']]), ('You such a dream come true, true
 Make a bitch wanna hit snooze, ooh', [['Ariana refers to her lover as a dream, similar to lyrics from her 2018 song R.E.M.

Before you speak, don’t move
‘Cause I don’t wanna wake up
Wake up, wake up, wake up
Don’t wanna wake up, oh
Wake up, wake up, wake up
Boy, you’re such a dream
If you can believe, babe
Boy, you’re such a dream to me']]), ('You might think I’m crazy
 The way I’ve been cravin’
 If I put it quite plainly
 Just gimme them babies', [["Ariana and one of her choreographers, Scott Nicholson, wrote these lines. On the album’s day of release, a fan on Twitter asked about Scott’s involvement with the song, to which Ariana replied:

oh the best night of my life
he brought us all the gift that is the “gimme them babies” line

In an interview with the Zach Sang Show, she explained how the writing session went down:

I was like what comes after ‘You might think I’m crazy / The way I’ve been cravin’ / If I put it quite plainly' and Scott was like ‘Just give me them babies’. He said that he was joking and I was like ‘No, no, no, we’re doing it, it’s done, it’s perfect’. It came up as a total joke and then I fell in love with it.

In a statement for Genius, Scott said:

To have a songwriting credit on the album is a dream come true. And on such a fun, cheeky song. Her and her team have made history, and continue to do so, and it’s a blessing to be a part of the team."]]), ('Even though I’m wifey, you can hit it like a side chick', [['To refer to a female partner as “wifey” indicates a long-term relationship. Oftentimes, the sex life of long-term partners tend to wind down after time as one or both partners lose interest in sex, engage in sexual activity less frequently, or get set into a routine. For these reasons, people may cheat and seek sexual encounters outside of their relationships.

However, Ariana assures her partner that they would not have to cheat because she would keep sex as interesting and exciting as if she was a new, secret lover.

Ariana first admitted being “wifey” back on her 2018 song “borderline”:

You know I’m the wifey type, babe

This line also might be referencing her song “break up with your girlfriend, i’m bored”, in which Ariana suggests she’ll let her love interest hit it even though he’s in a relationship.']]), ('Got the neighbors yellin’ “Earthquake!” (Earthquake)
 4.5 when I make the bed shake', [['The Richter scale measures the strength of earthquakes, ranging from magnitudes of one through ten. Ariana and her partner rock the bed so much during sex that it causes a 4.5, which is considered to be a moderate earthquake.

In an interview with the Zach Sang Show, Ariana shared that she wrote these lyrics after experiencing an earthquake earlier in 2020:

It was the night after the big earthquake, scared the shit out of me, and I was like ‘4.5 when I make the bed shake.’ That’s why that lyric is there.

The earthquake she mentions is either the magnitude 4.2 earthquake on July 30, or the magnitude 4.5 earthquake on September 18, both of which shook throughout Southern California and Los Angeles, where Grande resides.']]), ('Watchin’ movies, but we ain’t seen a thing tonight (Yeah)', [['Grande implies that the movie is background noise while she’s having sex with her partner. This is also a play on Netflix and chill, which itself is a euphemism for sex.

Ariana used a similar line on May 2016’s “Moonlight,” from her album Dangerous Woman:

And the movie is playing, but we won’t be watching tonight']]), ('Can you stay up all night?
 Fuck me ’til the daylight
 Thirty-four, thirty-five (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)
 Can you stay up all night? (All night)
 Fuck me ’til the daylight
 Thirty-four, thirty-five (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah)', [["34 and 35 amount to 69—a sexual position in which both partners experience oral pleasure during sex. The ‘6’ and the ‘9’ are intended to resemble inverted sexual partners lying on each other.

Ariana instructs her partner to use the position while having sex. It’s also a more overt reference to the sexual subtext from the lead single, “positions”:

Switchin' the positions for you
Cookin' in the kitchen and I’m in the bedroom

When discussing these lines in an interview with The Zach Sang Show, Ariana said:

The whole ‘Fuck me 'til the daylight’ thing is like… ridiculous. Because I’m tired after one, and it’s time to go to bed. For me it’s a total façade, it’s bullshit. Just kidding."]])]

genius_description:
“La Santa” es la segunda colaboración entre Bad Bunny y Daddy Yankee, luego de “Vuelve”. Esta vez, bajo la producción de Tainy, los artistas se decantaron por un ritmo de reggaetón que varía entre la rapidez del beat y sonidos suaves de fondo.

En la canción, ambos intérpretes describen a una mujer con la que recientemente tuvieron un romance, pero ella desconoce y se desentiende del contexto en que se conocieron: en una fiesta y bailando reggaetón. A medida que avanza la canción, también se deja claro que la mujer empezó a sentir un amor no correspondido, razón por la que Bad Bunny la enfrenta y ella busca alejarse de él.
genius_annotations:
[('A la flecha de Cupido siempre me le esquivo (Cucú)', [['Cupido es una figura mitológica romana y representa al amor. Es caracterizado como un niño alado poseedor de un arco y flecha, las que dispara a las personas que pretende enamorar.

Al decir que va a esquivar la flecha, Daddy Yankee quiere dar a entender que no se va a enamorar de la mujer.

Este personaje mitológico se ha convertido en uno de los íconos más conocidos de la festividad o Día de San Valentín, conocido como el día mundial del amor y celebrado el 14 de febrero de todos los años.']]), ('’Tás calentándote (Wow), yo calentándome (Eh)
 Y tú dice’ que tú ere’ brava, pero a vece’ te me quita (Rrr)', [["Daddy Yankee hace referencia a un tema suyo: “Aquí Está Tu Caldo”. Este tema del 2003 producido por Luny Tunes fue incluído en 2 discos: Blin Blin Vol. 1 y La Trayectoria, ambos discos de dichos productores.

‘Tás calentándote, yo calentándome
Tú dices que tú ere’ brava eso lo quiero ver
Sigue bailando, girl, sigue cucándome
Que te vo'a pegar bien duro contra la pare'

https://youtu.be/zD0Z2tacrxw?t=9"]])]

genius_description:
“Nobody but You” is a song recorded by American singer Blake Shelton for his compilation album Fully Loaded: God’s Country. The song features guest vocals from Gwen Stefani, marking the third collaboration between the two artists following “Go Ahead and Break My Heart” (2016) and “You Make It Feel Like Christmas” (2017).

Lyrically, the song describes a relationship between and couple and the love and admiration they share for each other.
genius_annotations: [('And wonder who you’re married to', [['Blake and Gwen were both married previously to Gavin Rossdale and Miranda Lambert respectively and when they got together the couple were both still hurting and didnt expect to fall in love. They have both said that they weren’t looking for a relationship but someone to lean on.']])]

genius_description:
“No Guidance” is the long-anticipated collaborative single between superstars Chris and Drake. The R&B record finds both artists tapping into their melodic sides as they sing about a girl who’s “got it.”

The collaboration was initially teased by Chris on his Instagram stories and later previewed at a nightclub during Chris' 30th birthday party.

Despite having been at odds previously—due to an incident at a nightclub in June 2012—the two artists reconciled in 2018 via Instagram and later on stage when Drake brought Chris out at his L.A. tour stop.
genius_annotations:
[('Way they hittin’ you, the DM lookin’ violent', [["The phrase to “hit on” is slang for talking with someone you’re sexually attracted to. Some start these conversations with potential partners by “DMing” them on an app called Instagram. More commonly, however, “hit” describes the simple act of striking someone.

In this bar, Drake refers to the sexual and standard definition of the word. Since so many people are sexually “hittin'” on this girl, he remarks that the her Instagram “DMs” must be filled with physical “violence” from all the slaps."]]), ('You a lil’ hot girl, you a lil’ sweetie (No, sweet)
 Sweet like Pearland, sweet like Peachtree (Like that)', [["Here Drake makes a reference to rapper Megan Thee Stallion who also goes by “Hot Girl Meg.” In the following line, Drake mentions Pearland, which is a city in the Houston area where Megan grew up. Megan also graduated from Pearland high school in 2013. On “No New Friends,” Drake refers to Houston as a “second home” which suggests that he is accustomed to the area:

H-town my second home like I’m James Harden

Peachtree is a location within Atlanta, somewhere he is all too familiar with according to his track “From Time” from his 2013 album Nothing Was the Same:

The one that I needed was Courtney from Hooters on Peachtree
I’ve always been feeling like she was the piece to complete me

Peachtree is also a well-known iced tea, famous for its rich taste. When he says, “you a lil' sweetie,” it also intentionally sounds like “you a lil' sweet tea.” Drake makes a subtle reference by telling the girl that just like the drink, he thinks that she is also very “sweet.”

Drake is known for dropping locations in various different songs, even including many locations within the song title, such as “9AM in Dallas,” “4PM in Calabasas,” and “6PM in New York.”"]]), ('Flew the coop at 17, no guidance', [['“Flew the coop” means to escape a place that limits freedom. It’s often used to describe children moving out of their parent’s home.

Drake and Chris Brown both dated Rihanna, which caused a mutual resentment between them. Interestingly, RiRi, born February 20, 1988, left her native Barbados to move to the States after she signed with Def Jam in 2005, when she was 17.

Drake captioned an instagram post with this lyric, which may indicate he drove fancy cars at a young age.']]), ('Pretty lil’ thing, you got a bag and now you wildin’', [["Drake rapped a similar line on his March 2013 track “5AM in Toronto”:

I mean, where you think she at when she ain’t with ya?
Wildin', doin' shit that’s way out of your budget"]]), ('You just took it off the lot, no mileage', [['Drake seems to imply that his romantic interest lacks sexual experience—“mileage” is slang for sexual encounters.

On his June 2010 track, “Thank Me Now,” Drake reflected on his sexual encounters:

That make me wish I had a little less mileage on me']]), ('Six God talk but I ain’t tryna get preachy (No, no, no)', [['Drake’s nickname, “Six God,” stems from the area code of his hometown of Toronto, Canada, which can be either 647 or 416. He first gave himself this title on the eponymous October 2014 track:

I give a fuck about old, boy (Man, that boy old)
I give a fuck about his squad, boy (Man, that thing old)
I give a fuck about your mob, boy (Oh)
I’m the real 6 God, boy (Whoa)

This line also contradicts a line from Drake’s February 2015 track, “Preach,” where PARTYNEXTDOOR encourages Drake to preach:

Young nigga preach

genius_description:
On “How Bout Now,” Drake flexes on an old flame of his. She didn’t appreciate him when they were together but now that Drake is a big superstar, he boasts that he’s “up” and she’s “stuck” in life.

The track was first leaked on October 19, 2014, by hackers. Six days later, Drake officially released it on his SoundCloud account as one of three promo tracks—the other two being “6 God” and “Heat of the Moment”—for his then-upcoming album, Views.

Four months later, on February 13, 2015, it was released as a bonus track on the physical version of If You’re Reading This It’s Too Late. Four years later, on August 2, 2019, it was made available on all streaming platforms, following the release of Care Package.
genius_annotations:
[('Crazy how you gotta wait until it’s dark out to see who really with you', [['Drake believes that he can only know who his real friends are during hard times. He touched on this before on February 2013’s, “Started From The Bottom”:

No new niggas, nigga, we don’t feel that
Fuck a fake friend, where your real friends at?']]), ('Them car rides made me feel like I was losin’ it
 Yeah, made me feel I ain’t have it like that
 Or I was average like that', [['Drake shared a similar sentiment on his November 2011 track, “Under Ground Kings”:

With fame on my mind, my girl on my nerves
I was pushing myself to get something that I deserve
That was back in the days, Acura days']]), ('I had no money left from actin’, I was focused on the music', [['Before Drake was a superstar, he played Jimmy Brooks from 2001 to 2009 in the Canadian teen-drama series, Degrassi: The Next Generation.



Drake spit a similar bar on his November 2011 track, “Look What You’ve Done”:

Told you I think I’m done acting, I’m more in touch with the music']]), ('I used to always try and burn you CDs of my new shit
 You be like “who’s this?” I be like “me, girl”
 You be like “oh, word, true shit?”
 Then ask if we could listen to Ludacris', [['This could be a shot at Kandice Henry, Drake’s ex-girlfriend who was rumored to have dated Ludacris before Drizzy. Luda confirmed this in a 2015 Breakfast Club interview.

http://instagram.com/p/pupjNPDQFa/

Drake and Luda had a short-lived beef in 2011, when Drake called him out in an interview, which led to Luda releasing a diss track. An August 2013 Complex article suggests that Drake may have dismissed it with a line from November 2011’s “Over My Dead Body”.

Drake ended his beef with Ludacris at the 2017 Billboard Music Awards.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BUYFe0OloEl/embed/']]), ('My heart belongs to you...', [['Here, Boi-1da samples Jodeci’s December 1993 smash hit, “My Heart Belongs To U.”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qh5h2hYMjbo

Drake is a big fan of Jodeci. He even titled his June 2013 track, “Jodeci Freestyle” in their honor.']]), ('That’s the shit I’m talking ‘bout though, like you changed up, you don’t even fuckin’ link nobody no more, you just dash me away like a cyattie. Yo, you cheesed me dog', [['Drake used a voicemail from a woman before on his June 2011 song, “Marvin’s Room,” except this time Drake has ghosted the woman.

The woman uses a mix of Jamaican patois and Toronto slang. “Link” means to contact or get in touch with someone, “dash away” means to not care or respond, “cyattie” means a “rachet” female and “cheesed me” means to make someone mad.']]), ('I bought your dad a bunch of shit for Christmas
 He ain’t even say thank you', [['Drake’s mother is Jewish, and Drake has fully embraced his Jewish heritage, as made evident in the April 2012 music video for “HYFR,” where he was “re-bar mitzvah’d as a re-commitment to the Jewish religion.”



Drake going out of his way to buy his girl’s father a present for Christmas, a holiday he doesn’t even celebrate, and go to church, shows how much he cares.']])]

genius_primary_artist: Ed Sheeran, Chris Stapleton & Bruno Mars
genius_description:
“BLOW” is the fifth single off of Ed Sheeran’s 2019  No. 6 Collaborations Project, released alongside “Best Part Of Me” one week before the album release.

The song takes a rock feel, and all three artists use the track to sing about a woman that drives them crazy and makes them want to take things to another level.
genius_annotations:
[('You want white lines in a limousine', [['Bruno is no stranger to white lines, having infamously been arrested in 2010 for possession of 2.6 grams of cocaine. The arrest followed a concert in Las Vegas, and his smiling mugshot (shown below) caught the attention of tabloids.



He was eventually cleared of the charges in 2012 after meeting the conditions of his plea deal, which included a $2,000 fine, probation, 200 hours of community service, and eight hours of drug counseling. In an interview with GQ, he opened up about what he learned from the incident:

‘I can take this shit away from you, young man.’ That was the lesson. You’ve slaved away for years and years and years. You’ve prepped your whole life. It’s all you know how to do. You’re a kid experiencing life in fucking Sin City, and that was the lesson: It can all be taken away.']])]

genius_description:
On her first proper single  since “First Time” with producer Kygo, Ellie Goulding teams up with producer Diplo and rapper Swae Lee of Rae Sremmurd for the trap-poppy “Close to Me,” written about the connection of two kindred spirits.

The song was premiered via BBC Radio 1 and released on October 24, 2018.

On the track, Goulding & Lee duet about their significant others who fuel their fire and how wild they are with them. For Goulding, this collaboration comes after her engagement with Casper Jopling.
genius_annotations:
[('I had to cut my bitch off, she bein’ stubborn (Stubborn)', [['This song is all about soulmates finding each other, so maybe he had to end things first with someone else to finally be together with this new person.

When it says she was being stubborn it could allude to how things are easier with this person who he feels so in sync with, as if his ex didn’t quite understand him.

This line could possibly make reference to Swae Lee’s break-up with Instagram model Marliesia Oritz, and the next line would be dedicated to KB Tate as they were spotted together in April 2018, “making it known” as if he had nothing to hide.']])]

genius_description:
Five Internet Money Records producers team up and enlist Gunna, Don Toliver, and NAV for “Lemonade,” the second single off of Internet Money’s debut studio album B4THESTORM. The song was released alongside an accompanying music video directed by Cole Bennett of Lyrical Lemonade.

This single was first previewed by Internet Money founder Taz Taylor during a June 2020 Instagram live. Gunna then previewed a snippet of his verse later that month.

The song then saw several leaks before surfacing in its entirety on July 14, 2020. Notably, a demo of Don’s solo version of the song leaked on June 24, 2020, revealing a verse absent from the final song.
genius_annotations:
[('All this money, when I grew up, I had nothing (Nothing)
 Filled with backstabbers, my old life was disgusting (Disgusting)
 Can’t believe it, gotta thank God that I’m livin’ comfortably (Thank God)
 Gettin’ checks, I don’t believe her, she say she done with me
 Burned some bridges and I let the fire light the way (Oh-woah)', [['NAV speaks on his come up in Toronto, and opens up about how he had nothing when he was growing uyp and then wormed his way up to the top and earns a lot more than what he expected.

He also speaks on his past friendships and how it has affected his path to success, proving he is better without them stabbing him in the back.']]), ('Lemonade', [['A gold chain (necklace) is often refereed to as “Lemonade”.
Because of the necklace pure yellowish and strong color.']]), ('Ice', [['A diamond is often referred to as ice.
often because of its ability to conduct heat higher than any other gemstone.
In pop culture it became a slang to diamonds necklaces, rings, earrings and other jewelry people and mainly rappers, wear.']]), ('Kickin’ my feet up, left the PJs on a PJ (A PJ)', [['Likely refers to leaving the “projects” (PJs) on a Private Jet.

Nav has come up from a harder life and now he can literally kick his feet up and relax.']]), ('I’m a rockstar, play guitars (Yeah), sippin’ Wock’, hey (Hey)', [['A rockstar plays an instrument, stereotypically a guitar, as part of a rock band. Most of Gunna’s tracks contain smooth guitar melodies (including this one) so Gunna refers to himself as a rockstar. He has also explicitly referred to himself as such on “ROCKSTAR BIKERS AND CHAINS”.

Other notable tracks of his that include guitar melodies include:


Gunna, “Sold Out Dates” (Apr. 2018)

Travis Scott, “YOSEMITE” (Aug. 2018)

Lil Baby & Gunna, “Drip Too Hard” (Sep. 2018)

Tory Lanez,  “MiAMi” (Oct. 2018)
Gunna, “Same Yung Nigga” (Feb. 2019)

Lil Mosey, “Stuck In A Dream” (Sep. 2019)

Roddy Ricch, “Start wit Me” (Oct. 2019)

A Boogie wit da Hoodie, “Numbers” (Feb. 2020)
Gunna, “WUNNA” & “MET GALA” (May 2020)

Pop Smoke, “Paranoia” (Jul. 2020)
Gunna, “NOTHING 4 FREE” (Jul. 2020)
Gunna, “DIRTY DIANA” (Jul. 2020)



Gunna’s virtual “Wunna Live in LA” concert also included him rapping over a live band that had a heavy emphasis on guitars.

Furthermore, Wockhardt Ltd. is a pharmaceutical company from Mumbai, India. They are best known for their promethazine and codeine cough syrup, which is commonly used to make lean.

Lean is a drink mixture usually containing cough syrup in a sweet soft drink base. The codeine in the cough syrup is known to cause feelings of lightness and euphoria, especially when taken in quantities greater than prescribed.']]), ('I got water on me, yeah, everything on Fiji', [['In this case, “water” refers to expensive jewelry because of their clarity. It is a popularized term in hip-hop music, such as on NAV’s March 2019 track, “Hold Your Breath,” in which he says:

Diamonds water, you wear my chain, gotta hold your breath (Breath)



Interestingly, NAV rapped about Molly, name-dropping Fiji water to show he was only talking about the Molly water on his feature on Travis Scott’s September 2016 hit track, “beibs in the trap,” in which he says:

Told Frost bring the water, no Fiji

“Water” also has a broader definition; it could be referring to his “drip,” or simply his clothing. Water is wet so it drips, and “drip” is a slang term for expensive or fashionable clothing.']]), ('Got a penthouse near Rodeo off of stress (Stress)', [['Rodeo Drive is a famous street in Beverly Hills, California, known for its three block stretch of luxury goods stores. Many celebrities and rich people live on or near the street, such as American model and media personality Kylie Jenner and fellow Canadian singer Justin Bieber. NAV also lives close to the street, which is why he’s saying he has a penthouse there. However, a penthouse is an area on the highest floor of a place; NAV actually lives in a mansion, which is even better.']]), ('In my earlobe, got two karats, VVS (Bling)', [['NAV used to wear earrings back in 2016 and 2017, but stopped for a few years. At the time of this single’s release, he had recently gotten earrings again. He can be seen wearing them on the official music video for his friend Trav’s July 2020 single “Pradaaa Shoes,”, which he was featured on.



VVS is an acronym for Very, Very Slightly [Included], a score, representing the clarity of expensive jewelry. These earrings are clearly VVS. The “two karats” refers to the gold in the earrings, as karats are a unit used to measure gold.']]), ('Lips sealed, I ain’t pillow talkin’, I’m no rat (No)', [['This could be a reference to fellow rapper 6ix9ine and his trial in 2019, in which he testified against the members of his former gang, the Nine Trey Bloods and received a 2-year sentence, with credit for 13 months already served, with 11 more months to serve. However, 6ix9ine was released 4 months early due to his asthma, which made him more vulnerable to COVID-19.

This incident led rappers and fans to coin the term “rat,” which is also a slang term for “snitch.” In this case, based on the previous line, NAV is stating about having drugs and money in his bag. Hence, he has his lips sealed and will not tell anybody so he or his crew will not get caught, most likely by police.

Additionally, in a virtual Instagram Live interview with Bootleg Kev on May 8, 2020, NAV stated he would never work with 6ix9ine because he will not get rid of his “human values.”']]), ('And that’s on my government name (Nah)', [['Gunna’s legal ‘government’ (birth/legal name) is Sergio Giavanni Kitchens.

Swearing on “your government name” means you swear to never change the view you’re swearing on. While rappers may change aliases, like most regular people they never change their government name.']])]

genius_description:
On “​t h e . c l i m b . b a c k,” J. Cole talks about rediscovering his love for rap and some of his traumatic life experiences.

Two days before releasing the song, Cole published an essay titled “The Audacity” in which he discussed several critical periods of his life and the persistent obligation to achieve his goals. He specifically utilized the word ‘climb’ to describe how he advanced himself in each of these periods, which can be seen as a prelude to this song.

This and “Lion King on Ice” were intended to be the first two singles from Cole’s seventh studio album, The Fall Off. They were released together as the two-track Lewis Street.

On May 12, 2021, “The Climb Back” was reformatted to “t h e c l i m b b a c k” on streaming services. The following day, it was confirmed that it would now be included as a track on The Off-Season, instead of its original placement on The Fall Off, making it the LP’s lead single. The periods weren’t added to the title until the album’s release.
genius_annotations:
[('Everything come back around full circle', [['J Cole uses this chorus to paint across dualities: lies v truth; cry v smile; life v coming back from the dead; night v light.

And yet all of this begins this with things coming back around full circle?

It’s because a sine wave is derived from the movement of a point around a circle. Because the nature of our existence is essentially circular (we orbit the Sun, the Moon orbits us, electrons in an atom orbit the nucleus), we experience life in sine waves.

So, Cole’s chorus is saying the dualities of life are caused by the circular nature of reality.']]), ('At times, it be feelin’ the devil be winnin’ but do that mean God', [['it’s about god fighting the devil and banishing him']]), ('Now I know why they call it blue moon (Yeah', [['The next Blue Moon is August 22 2021.

https://earthsky.org/astronomy-essentials/when-is-the-next-blue-moon/']]), ('Or they gon’ for sure blow your clothes half off like a promo code', [['J Cole references the term “promo code” which typically advertises purchasing an item with a discount.

In this verse, he may be referring to individuals fatally shooting someone.']]), ('Tryna find the derivative', [["This line can be interpreted in a mathematical sense, as finding the derivate is a part of differential calculus.

The first derivative of a mathematical function tells us the gradient of the function, or how steep/flat it is.

Cole uses this meaning to craft some nifty wordplay with the previous line “the steepest of mountains, they tryin' to climb”.

Cole talks about how he is not trying to climb this mountain, instead showing his wit by simply calculating the derivative."]]), ('Well, I ain’t with that sleepin’ underground like a gopher, so I go for mines', [["This is a play on the homophone words “gopher” and “go-for”. Gophers sleep underground and mines are also planted underground.

This could also be a nod to Eminem’s verse on “Medicine Man”.

As sure as a mole is blind
In my mind I’m still underground as a groundhog
And I'ma go for mine, like a whole furrow just tryna dig up some gold and diamonds and coal to find"]]), ('Gettin’ in tune with my God', [['Cole uses my God, as a non descriptive way to say he follows a religion but is unsure on what one he should follow. This links to Let Go Of My Hand, where Cole says he follows multiple religions. https://genius.com/J-cole-bas-and-6lack-l-e-t-g-o-m-y-h-a-n-d-lyrics']]), ('Just to get by for a limited time, the steepest of mountains, they tryin’ to climb', [['Here, Cole criticizes the notion that many people nowadays believe in, that success has to come fast and that you should do anything to get your “15 Minutes of Fame”, even though that might not bring you success in the long run.

Cole himself broke into the spotlight in 2007 with his debut mixtape “The Come Up” which garnered critical acclaim.
He has since dropped six studio albums and has undoubtedly made a mark in the Hip-Hop world with many artists and music consumers alike stating that he is a prominent artist that deserves recognition for his craft.

Judging from all of this, J. Cole can very well be seen as a rapper whose years of dedicated work into perfecting his style has brought him great success.']]), ('Are you doin’ this work to facilitate growth or to become famous?
 Which is more important?
 Getting or letting go?', [['The intro derives from an audiobook rendition of the Book The Tao of Leadership by  John Heider.

https://youtu.be/wdD80MkLEE4?t=1260']]), ('To the left of that decimal, I need seven figures to play the joint', [['Cole declares his starting price for a concert, stating that he needs at least “seven figures,” which means a million dollars. This is because there are seven digits to the left of the decimal when a monetary amount is written (i.e. $4,237,000.85).

Cole’s most recent tour before releasing this song, 2018’s KOD Tour, amassed $26.9 million dollars from 36 dates, so he averaged nearly $750,000 per show. Because of his stardom’s growth since 2018, Cole is now upgrading his price by more than $250,000.

Cole has been more boastful about his wealth in his recent musical offerings; on Young Thug’s May 2019 single, “The London,” he raps about the value of the words in his guest verses:

A verse from me is like eleven birds
Just did the math, that’s like two thousand dollars every word']])]

genius_description:
Written as a protest song against the Vietnam War, “Happy Xmas (War Is Over)” was the end result of two years of activism by John Lennon & Yoko Ono. Backing vocals on the song are also provided by the Harlem Community Choir.

“WAR IS OVER! If You Want It – Happy Christmas from John & Yoko” was the message displayed on numerous billboards in a dozen major cities around the world.
genius_annotations:
[('For weak and for strong (If you want it)', [['yes']]), ('For yellow and red ones (War is over)
 Let’s stop all the fight (Now)', [['Yellow refers, mainly, to Vietnamese people.  It was already a somewhat offensive term at the time, but it was considered acceptable to use it to highlight that the real offense was how American military policy was dehumanizing the Vietnamese far more than any mere words could do.

And red?  Well, it could refer to Native Americans then as now, but in the context of this song, it also referred to the Vietnamese Communists.  Communists of all nations have long been associated with the color red.']]), ('(Happy Christmas, Kyoko
 Happy Christmas, Julian)', [['At the beginning of the song, two whispers can be heard. Yoko whispers: “Happy Christmas, Kyoko” (Kyoko Chan Cox is Yoko’s daughter with Anthony Cox); John whispers: “Happy Christmas, Julian” (Julian Lennon is John’s son with Cynthia Lennon).

Kyoko and Julian are both children that John and Yoko had with other people. Yet, John and Yoko wish both a happy Christmas. This message signifies affection and love beyond borders, in spite of hardship and differences.']]), ('War is over, if you want it
 War is over, now', [["John and Yoko spent a lot of time in the late ‘60s and early '70s working to promote peace. In 1969, they put up billboard advertisements in major cities around the world that said, “War is over! (If you want it).” Two years later this slogan became the basis for this song when Lennon decided to make a Christmas record with an anti-war message. John also claimed another inspiration for writing the song: he said he was “sick of 'White Christmas.’”"]]), ('A very Merry Christmas
 And a happy New Year
 Let’s hope it’s a good one
 Without any fear', [['Recognising the accessibility and popular appeal that made his 1971 single “Imagine” a commercial success compared to the other songs he had released up to that point, Lennon concluded, “Now I understand what you have to do: Put your political message across with a little honey.” He conceived “Happy Xmas (War Is Over)” as a means of elaborating upon the themes of social unity and peaceful change enacted through personal accountability and empowerment that served as the basis of the earlier billboard campaign, trying to convey optimism whilst avoiding the sentimentality that he felt often characterised music of the holiday season.']])]
genius_comments:
['The lyrics on this page for John Lennon’s “Happy Christmas” contain an error.

Your line: “The world is so wrong” is incorrect.

John sings: “The road is so long”

John was a lover of life, people and the world, no matter the problems. He would have never said the world is wrong. Fixing this would be the right thing to do.

Thank you,
C. Love', 'The line “the world is so wrong” is not correct, John Lennon sings “the road is so long”.']

genius_description:
“Outta My Head” sees Khalid linking up with singer/songwriter/guitarist John Mayer and chronicling the passionate thoughts swirling through his mind about a girl. Whether they are together or apart, she makes him absolutely crazy.

Khalid described the John Mayer collaboration as a matter of chance:

I think ‘Outta My Head’ is definitely my favorite because of just how timing came into play. It was ridiculous—I’m walking out of the studio and I run into John Mayer. And then I’m like, ‘Yo, you want to hear my project?’ Third song in and then he hopped on it and it was great. It’s such a moment.
genius_annotations: [('(All night long)', [['Khalid and John Mayer incorporates the beat and sound of Lionel Richie’s 1983 song All Night Long (All Night).']]), ('[Bridge]', [['During the bridge we finally get to see John Mayer let loose as he plays a rather slow and bluesy guitar solo over Khalid’s vocals which serve almost as soothing background textures to compliment John’s style of playing.']])]

genius_description:
“The Voice” is a track from Chicago rapper Lil Durk, serving as the lead single to his upcoming untitled sixth studio album. The official music video was released on September 4, 2020, alongside the track.

On this song, Lil Durk reminisces on his old life in the streets in a sad tone, dropping lines about sexual activity, legal issues, and weapons. While rapping on the two verses, Durk sings with a robotic auto-tune on the chorus.

Lil Durk teased the existence of this song, in early May 2020, when he changed his Twitter name to “THE VOICE.” He then ultimately announced the song’s release date via Twitter on August 28, 2020.
genius_annotations:
[('I can’t even vote for who I believe in, shit ain’t goin’ right', [['In 2011, Lil Durk was arrested on weapon charges including possession of a firearm with a defaced serial number. Illinois and Chicago have strict gun laws in an attempt to combat gun violence, so when Durk pled guilty to a lesser charge of aggravated unauthorized use of a weapon, he became a convicted felon.

Due to his felon status, Durk lost certain rights such as the right to vote. Considering Durk calls himself “The Voice” and is outspoken about societal issues, it is understandable that he finds it frustrating that he cannot express his political beliefs in elections.']]), ('And I nut in all the hoes I fuck, I blame the porn site', [['Lil Durk blames our overly sexual culture for his dangerous sexual behaviors. Porn portrays women as objects to be used for sex. The use of a condom prevents the spread of AIDS and unintentional pregnancies.']]), ('Quarantine what? I’m just tryna make a buck', [['Even through the recent spread of Covid-19, Durk is still grinding and still trying to maintain despite the spread.']]), ('Became the voice of the streets and my people ain’t believe in me
 I’m supportive of the streets and them people ain’t believe in me', [['When Durk first started he really wasn’t supported that much in his city. He felt Chicago overlooked and ain’t see his vision. This left a scar on his heart due to him always staying real to those from the same streets/slums of Chicago. He never turned hollywood and feel like the city of Chicago still never supported em.']]), ('Please don’t turn away from me
 I got enough on my plate tryna turn away, tryna turn away', [['Durk has been switched on much in his life and is simply begging for whomever to stick around. For those who have people switched up on you, you should be able to relate to this plea.']])]

genius_description:
On “Give No Fxk,“ Atlanta stars Migos reunite with frequent collaborators Travis Scott and Young Thug for a braggadocios trap anthem. The song marks the five artists' first appearance all together on a song and is expected to serve as the lead single off of the last installment of Migos' Culture trilogy, Culture III, which has been announced to be released in 2020.

The collaboration was first teased on November 11, 2019, in an Instagram live stream before being debuted a few hours later at Travis' ASTROWORLD FESTIVAL, alongside Migos and Thug for the first live performance. The song officially released on February 14, 2020, complemented by its Valentine’s Day release date.
genius_annotations:
[('I done went set up the Jack and made sure the pack ain’t gotta push packs quite', [['Travis shouts out the members of his rap label Cactus Jack Records. Under his cosign, he has brought several underground rappers like Don Toliver, Sheck Wes, and Luxury Tax to mainstream fame, making sure that they are set for life as they don’t have to “push packs"—slang for selling drugs.

The record label is known as JACKBOYS. Their self-titled compilation album with Travis released in late December 2019, the last full week of the year. In the album, Quavo and Offset are featured on Don’s “HAD ENOUGH” and Thug is featured on JACKBOYS and Travis' “OUT WEST”.']]), ('I done been ’round the whole globe and did a few laps and brought back a whole tide', [['Travis Scott is quite the globetrotter — the Houston native has traveled all over the world, from London to Poland to Morocco to Montréal.

Suffice it to say, Travis is extremely influential — the rapper has had several top Billboard hits. He comments on his music’s ability to capture fans and create waves in the world similar to the moon which influences tides with its gravity.']]), ('I got too many diamonds on, I look awesome (Ice, get right)', [['Quavo indeed owns a lot of jewelry. In October 2018, the Atlanta rapper stepped by GQ to show off his impressive collection, which includes “iced out” rings, bracelets, glasses, earrings, watches and chains.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3MJo40SgETs
When asked by GQ about his ‘jewelry heroes’, Quavo named Gucci Mane, Busta Rhymes, and Johnny Dang as his sources of inspiration.']]), ('Pray my soul to keep when I go to sleep (Uh, Huncho)', [['Quavo interpolates famous 18th-century children’s bedtime prayer “Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep”:

Now I lay me down to sleep,
I pray the Lord my soul to keep,
If I should die before I ‘wake,
I pray the Lord my soul to take.

The lyrics as they are known today are a revised version of the bedtime prayer originally written by English writer Joesph Addison:

When I lay me down to Sleep,
I recommend my self to His care;
when I awake, I give my self up to His Direction,
     Amen.

Quavo is far from being the first rapper to nod to the children’s prayer. From Kid Cudi on his July 2008 song “The Prayer” to XXXTENTACION on his March 2018 song “before I close my eyes,” including Calboy on his March 2018 hit “Envy Me,” many other artists have famously interpolated “Now I Lay Me Down To Sleep” in their lyrics.']]), ('Murda on the beat, so it’s not nice', [['This producer tag is voiced by Baka Not Nice, a rapper from Toronto. It originated from the chorus of his 2016 Murda Beatz produced track, “AKA”:

Murda on the beat, so it’s not nice (Murda)
Murda on the beat, so it’s not nice (Murda)

The tag can also be heard on his 2017 collaboration with Travis Scott,  “Butterfly Effect”, as well as with Migos member, Quavo on “Portland”. He has also previously worked with Migos on “Motorsport”, featuring Nicki and Cardi B.']])]

genius_description:
“For The Night” is the 3rd track off of the late Pop Smoke’s album, Shoot for the Stars Aim for the Moon. Besides being off a highly anticipated album, the song was also highly popularized due to a Tiktok dance surrounding the song.

This song marks the first collaboration between Pop, Lil Baby, and DaBaby. On a beat produced by CashMoneyAP and MIKE DEAN, the trio talk about their nighttime activities, how they act around women, and their now-lavish lifestyles. The song points to how the rappers don’t want a long-term relationship, wanting only a companion, “For the Night”.
genius_annotations:
[('I’m rich but I’m ridin’, I’m low on exotic, I’m ’bout to fly out and go get me some', [['Exotic, or exotic weed, is a slang term for high-potency cannabis popular with street culture and rap music. It is also known as “zaza.” (Leafly)

Just as a tiger is exotic in America but not India, the label of exotic cannabis depends on the location and audience. To a newbie, almost anything with a high THC count and colorful trichome crystals will feel exotic. But the term does not traditionally describe familiar favorites like OG Kush, Sour Diesel or Jack Herer.

The name suggests origins in the tropics or Middle East, but for many it is nothing more than a marketing tool used to classify ambiguous but potent strains whose true genealogy is unknown to the dealer.

A supplier offering an exotic strain could have anything from a fruity sativa to a dark purple indica, but the general standard for the name is a top-shelf strain that is both rare for the region and has extremely noticeable effects. (Leafly)

Depending on where you’re at and the weed available, it could be worth the flight out to get something proper']]), ('Nothin’ ain’t seen, all this money on me, hunnid racks in the bag, that’s a honey bun', [['A “honey bun” is a slang term for one million US dollars. The phrase originates from a public defender stating in prison:

In prison, a honey bun is like a million dollars

In the case, guards in Miami, Florida at the prison paid for the beating of a teenager at a youth detention center ending up killing the teenager.']]), ('Learned ‘bout the triple cross when I was young and I know I ain’t goin’ so I keep a gun', [['The “triple cross” Lil Baby is alluding to are the three aspects of God in Christianity also known as “the Trinity”: the Father, Son (otherwise known as Jesus Christ), and Holy Spirit. In the scripture of Matthew 28:19, quoted from the Bible, Jesus mentions the Trinity:

Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit

Lil Baby infers that he isn’t going to Heaven probably because of “sinful” or illegal activities he has participated in, that’s why he keeps a gun with him so he can defend himself and stay alive for as long as possible.']]), ('I flew to Paris just to buy some Dior', [['Christian Dior SE is a luxury designer brand originating from Paris, France.



Christian Dior’s main flagship

Baby brags about his wealth, and also nods to one of Pop Smoke’s biggest hits released in 2019, “Dior” where he raps:

Christian Dior, Dior
I’m up in all the stores
When it rains, it pours']]), ('I’m a thief in the night (Thief in the night), oh', [["The popular saying “thief in the night” originated from a Biblical New Testament expression where Jesus Christ himself prophesied about his second coming. Revelation 16:15 states this:

Look, I come like a thief! Blessed is the one who stays awake and remains clothed, so as not to go naked and be shamefully exposed.

In 1 Thessalonians 5:1-2, the author Paul the Apostle wrote this to warn fellow Christians of the quick arrival of Jesus' second coming:

1 Now, brothers and sisters, about times and dates we do not need to write to you, 2 for you know very well that the day of the Lord will come like a thief in the night.

Pop Smoke uses this Biblical analogy to represent his sexual prowess in the night."]]), ('I’m in a Rolls-Royce with a RiRi', [['By a “RiRi,” Lil Baby is comparing his companion in his Rolls-Royce to the famous singer Rihanna, commonly referred to as “RiRi.” Her instagram handle is famously entitled: “badgalriri”']]), ('Baby OG, I been runnin’ these streets, got the game from Lashawn, I’m my mama’s son', [['LaShawn Jones is Lil Baby’s mother and has been featured heavily in his biographic documentary Preacherman.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VS0utODCw2E']]), ('C.I.P. Pop, I wish that you could see us', [['The acronym “C.I.P.” stands for “Crip In Peace” as a nod to the gang, the Crips. The Crips are a large street gang based in Southern California known for being involved in serious crimes such as murder, robberies, and drug dealing, amongst others. Many popular rappers such as Snoop Dogg, the late Nipsey Hussle, Eazy-E, and even Lil Baby have been involved in the Crips. Pop Smoke was supposedly affiliated with the Crips gang, according to a federal prosecutor, which possibly lead to his death in February 2020.

Pop made a nod to being a member of the Crips in the eighth-track Armed N Dangerous (Charlie Sloth Freestyle) off of his second studio sequel album Meet The Woo 2:

Pop Smoke on apeshit, but everybody know I’m Crip']]), ('CashMoneyAP', [['This is one of the producer tags for French producer Alex Petit.

He produced the fifth track on Shoot for the Stars Aim for the Moon “Gangstas” and has previously worked on Pop Smoke’s 2020 promotional single “Christopher Walking” off of his sequel album Meet The Woo 2 and DaBaby’s “POP STAR” from his second studio album released in late 2019 entitled KIRK.']]), ('Like to shoot, light you up, bitch, I’m Rambo', [['Rambo is known for his extraordinary fighting skills, the reason why Dababy compares his gun shooting skills with Rambo’s skills.

Rambo – more precisely known as John Rambo – is a fictional character from the American action thriller novel, First Blood, written by David Morrell and released in 1972.

The fictional character was further popularised by the American action film, First Blood, released in 1982, and based on the original novel.



Rambo']])]

genius_description: “Snitching" is the eighth track from Pop Smoke’s debut posthumous album Shoot for the Stars, Aim for the Moon featuring Atlanta-based rappers Quavo and Future bragging about their status and wealth. It is produced by Buddah Bless and SethInTheKitchen.
genius_annotations:
[('I was out trappin’ with keys like Alicia', [['Future likens himself to the well-acclaimed singer-songwriter and pianist Alicia Keys who splices upbeat pop with her soulful R&B ballads. She has won various awards at the Grammys and hosted the 2019 GRAMMY award show, among other accolades. Some of her best-selling records include, the debut album Songs in A Minor released in 2001, her 2003 sophomore effort The Diary of Alicia Keys and hit songs “No One” and “If I Ain’t Got You.”']]), ('Damn (Woo), snitchin’
 Niggas be out here snitchin’, uh (Woo)
 Damn, snitchin’
 Niggas be out here snitchin’, uh (Snitchin’)
 Snitchin’
 Niggas be out here snitchin’, uh (Snitchin’)
 Damn, snitchin’
 Niggas be out here snitchin’, uh (Damn)', [['In the Rap/Hip-Hop scene, there has always been a history of rappers co-operating with the police. Usually they are from the streets/ghettos of America, notorious for gang violence, drug dealing, and high crime rates.

“Snitching” or being a snitch is when a witness reports a crime to the police. Being known as a snitch or snitching on gangs in general, is not a good look in those areas specifically. It has gotten people badly injured and killed such as the late Los Angeles-based rapper Nipsey Hussle. Most notably, the rapper Tekashi 6ix9ine who was released from jail in early 2020, was being clowned by many rappers such as Meek Mill, Fat Joe, and Pop Smoke. Tekashi was originally arrested due to snitching in 2018 on his own gang in New York.



Tekashi 69 pleading guilty in a trial']]), ('Bobby Brown, Bobby Brown', [['Bobby Brown is a famous songwriter who was also married to the legendary singer, Whitney Houston. Just like his spouse Whitney, he struggled with drug addiction throughout the 1990s and early 2000s.']]), ('I caught a wave on some Maison Margiela
 Audemars, water, Beretta, vendetta
 Stella McCartney, it came with the bezel', [['In these lines, Future shouts out some of his favorite expensive luxury brands and items he has acquired due to his fame and fortune:

• Maison Margiela is a French fashion brand founded by Belgian designer Martin Margiela.

• Audemars Piguet is a Swiss luxury brand known for their expensive and high-quality watches.

• Beretta is an Italian firearms brand famous for their successful and reliable pistols.

• Stella McCartney is a legendary fashion designer and the daughter of Paul McCartney. A “bezel” is a type of ring setting in jewelry.']]), ('Pour up a four like I’m young Tony Snow', [['Tony Snow is an alias of the legendary rapper Pimp C of UGK who was widely-known for his abusive use of the pain-killer drug codeine.

The phrase “pour up a fourth” refers to the four fluid ounces in the mixture of codeine.']]), ('[Intro]', [['The introduction of the track is sampled from a skit from social media comedian Bubba Dub. The sampled portion of the clip begins at the timestamp 1:05:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vPjURf03Lno&t=65']]), ('I’m Evel Knievel, these niggas some divas', [['Evel Knieval was a legendary stunt driver famous for his daring motorcycle jumps. He later died in 2007, due to a respiratory disease.



Future compares himself to Evel Knieval because of his fearless persona and dangerous actions he frequently commits.']]), ('My bitch want a Patek (Patek)
 I bought her a whip and I told her, “Stop naggin’” (Skrr)', [['Patek Philippe SA is a Swiss luxury and costly brand founded in 1839 originally located in Geneva, Switzerland. They are known for their high-quality watches up to par with other popular brands such as Rolex and Audemars Piguet, amongst others.



A Patek Philippe Ladies Aquanaut Luce Haute Joaillerie Watch priced around $200,000 US dollars

Since mid-2018 Quavo has been dating the Bay Area rapper Saweetie, well-known for her tracks “My Type” and “ICY GRL.”

It is currently unknown whether Quavo has purchased Saweetie a car. He did buy her a $75,000 snowflake chain at Atlanta-based jewelry store Icebox for Christmas in 2019. Similarly, Saweetie supprised Quavo with a 1961 Chevy Impala for his 28th birthday in 2019 which he shared via social media.']]), ('Said I pull up, Amiri, got ninas attached', [['Amiri is a luxury fashion brand founded by Californian designer Mike Amiri. The brand is immensely popular, particularly amongst rappers and celebrities, and has been seen on the likes of Justin Bieber, Future and Odell Beckham Jr.

Throughout his career, Pop was an avid supporter of Amiri and shouted him out on numerous tracks, most notably example on his 2019 smash hit “Dior”:

Mike Amiri, Mike Amiri
Billie Jean, Billie Jean (Uh)



Pop exiting a car wearing a Dior t-shirt and Amiri jeans

Coincidentally, Mike Amiri unintentionally played a pivotal role in Pop’s tragic death. In February 2020, while singing along to “Dior” in the background, Pop took to his Facebook stories to post a video of gifts Amiri had sent him. Pop’s address was briefly legible on the packaging, which is what allowed the perpetrators to track down Pop’s location and kill him.

Further, a “nina” is a slang term for a 9mm handgun. Pop references the gun later in his verse, rapping:

I had to shoot it in class (Class)
I had the ninas attached

Pop used a similar line on the opening bars of his 2020 track “Dreaming”:

Amiri the denims, got ninas attached']]), ('If Quavo told me get him, then I’ma do the dash (I’ma do the dash)
 Yeah, yeah, dash (Dash), I take off like a rocket (Yeah)', [["Pop Smoke states that if Quavo wants someone killed, he will murder them without hesitation and make a swift departure from the crime scene in an effort to evade the police.

The latter half of this line may be a reference to Quavo’s nephew, and fellow Migos member, Takeoff. Takeoff has used frequently used aerospace motifs throughout his career; his 2018 debut solo album was aptly titled The Last Rocket and he has a NASA Solar System inspired chain worth an estimated $500K.

Pop, Takeoff and Quavo collaborated on the June 2021 track “Light It Up”, which was featured on Migos' fourth studio album Culture III."]])]

genius_description:
“Sunflower” marks the second collaboration by Post Malone and Swae Lee. It serves as the second single for Post Malone’s 2019 album, Hollywood’s Bleeding, and is part of the soundtrack for the 2018 animated film Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse. The track would end up breaking the record for most weeks spent in the top 10 of the Billboard Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs Chart after notching its 45th week.

Sunflowers are a symbol of loyalty and longevity because of the flower’s ability to retain its beauty in the face of environmental factors that would leave other flowers wilted. The sunflower in this song represents a girl—a woman who’s shown persistence, despite a lack of affection shown to her. However, sunflowers also deplete nutrients from soil much quicker than other plants and can inhibit the growth of other plants. Post Malone’s verses could imply that the person he’s with is in constant need of help and attention, yet he is unable to tend to them as much as they would like.

This mystery girl ends up being the subject matter for both Post Malone and Swae Lee. In their verses, the girl seems to be trying much harder in the relationship than either of the two stars. However, even after all of the poor treatment the girl has received, she remains by Post and Swae’s side.

Post first teased the song at The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon on October 1, 2018. He then confirmed on Facebook that the song would include Swae Lee. Two snippets from the lyric video were shown on both of their Instagram accounts on October 15, 2018.
genius_annotations:
[('Then you’re left in the dust, unless I stuck by ya
 You’re a sunflower, I think your love would be too much
 Or you’ll be left in the dust, unless I stuck by ya
 You’re the sunflower, you’re the sunflower', [['“Sunflower” is Miles Morales‘ favorite song; he sings it throughout Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse.



Sunflowers are known to rapidly deplete their soil of nutrients. Swae and Post use this as a metaphor for the effects that several characters have on Miles, which simultaneously overwhelms and motivates him throughout the movie. This is similar to how a sunflower is destructive and yet produces something beautiful.']])]

genius_description:
On “F*CK YOU, GOODBYE,” The Kid LAROI and Machine Gun Kelly dive into their familiar relationship issues, as LAROI makes clear his discontent with his partner and his want to end their relationship. The two communicate their feelings over a guitar-based trap beat.

An early version of the song leaked in summer 2020 and was featured in episode 2 of the trailer for F*CK LOVE (SAVAGE), seemingly confirming its placement on the project.
genius_annotations:
[('Your things are still in the box that you left in the bedroom
 You’ll leave, and I’m here', [['Colson (Machine Gun Kelly) Baker’s Mom left him when he was 9 years old to live a life with another man. This lyric refers to his Mom leaving with her possessions still in her room which she left.

Recently on June 30 of 2021, Colson thanked fans as the relationship between him and his Mom are coming back
Colson tweeted:
“wild story but after all these years, the fans are responsible for me and my mom finally reconnecting

i love you"']]), ('Ghost in a shell, stoned like a cemetery', [['Ghost in the Shell[a] is a Japanese cyberpunk media franchise based on the seinen manga series of the same name written and illustrated by Masamune Shirow. The manga, first serialized in 1989 under the subtitle of The Ghost in the Shell, and later published as its own tankōbon volumes by Kodansha, told the story of the fictional counter-cyberterrorist organization Public Security Section 9, led by protagonist Major Motoko Kusanagi, and is set in mid-21st century Japan.



Ghost in the Shell is a series with a key element, being people giving up certain organs and becoming cyberized to become stronger, MGK referenced this with this small bar as “With no heart” and in Ghost in the Shell people remove organs like their hearts, as well as having this right before this blatant reference seems to greatly imply that he is in fact talking about Ghost in the Shell.']]), ('Because I cannot erase you like eternal sunshine in a spotless mind', [['This line reference’s Jim Carrey’s movie “Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind” in which Jim’s character Joel meets a girl Clementine (Kate Winslet) and they go to a frozen lake without realizing that they had already attended together two years prior when they were dating. What is shown is that the two separately underwent a memory-erasing procedure.

This line, therefore, is Colson (MGK) saying that he was so into the relationship that it wouldn’t even be possible to erase it from his mind as Jim and Clementine did.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=07-QBnEkgXU']]), ('Highway to hell, I’m hangin’ out the roof, yellin’', [['Callback to AC/DC’s hit song “Highway to Hell”.
Highway to hell was the nickname for the canning highway in australia. It runs from where lead singer bon scott lived in fremantle and ends at the pub called “the raffles”, which was a big rock and roll drinking hole in the ‘70s.']])]

genius_description: “Last Christmas” is a song by Wham! It’s been widely covered by a mutlitude of artists, including Taylor Swift and Jimmy Eat World The song reached No. 1 in 2 countries and reached No. 2 in eight countries. Although often played during Christmas time, it is far from a Christmas themed song. It tells the story of a failed relationship and the sadness that the holiday triggers.
genius_annotations:
[('I meant it
 Now I know what a fool I’ve been', [['George opines how he felt true love from the relationship; however, he now sees that it was foolish of him to be so enchanted his affection was unrequited.']]), ('Now I’ve found a real love, you’ll never fool me again', [['The final line of Verse 4 contradicts the concluding line of Verse 2, signaling things have progressed and the that singer has developed from his experiences.

Although it might simply seem that he has found a new love, it may actually be conveying that he has found the meaning of true love (this interpretation is supported by the continued use of “I’ll give it to someone special” afterwards).

Lastly, the line shifts the tone for the rest of the song, as the singer no longer longs for his previous partner, truly looking for someone new.']]), ('I keep my distance, but you still catch my eye', [['While George tries to keep distance from the person he is referring to, his eyes still linger on him/her. George thus admits that he is still vulnerable.']]), ('Tell me, baby, do you recognize me?
 Well, it’s been a year, it doesn’t surprise me', [['He notices an ex-lover from across the room, and wonders if this person notices him too. Apparently the person doesn’t, and he understands because it’s been a year since they last saw each other.



Because George Michael was still in the closet when he wrote this song, most people think it is about a female, but it could’ve easily been written for a male instead.']]), ('Once bitten and twice shy', [['This phrase (idiom) means to avoid something or someone because of what it/they did to you.

In this case, George Michael tries to avoid his ex-lover because they gave his heart away the next day it was given to them.']])]

genius_description:
“Fallin'” marks Why Don’t We’s first release since they began their eight-month hiatus at the start of 2020, following their 2019 project in which they released a single each month.

The single was released at 12PM ET on September 29, 2020 just two days after the band’s four-year anniversary.

Interestingly, Why Don’t We featured a song called “Falling” on the debut album, 8 Letters, released in 2018. Upon the release of “Fallin'”, the track named was changed to “Can’t You See” on streaming services.

On October 23, 2020, the song’s title was changed to “Fallin' (Adrenaline)” on streaming services to further distinguish itself from “Can’t You See.”

In an Instagram post the band shared:

fallin’ was the last song we wrote in the studio and the first one we wanted to share with you. there’s no other way to describe it except it just felt right. we can’t wait for you to hear it.

genius_description:
On “Arms Around You,” XXXTENTACION, Swae Lee, and Maluma each sing about embracing a woman that they love. Lil Pump’s verse, however, is inconsistent with this theme as he raps about his wealth, drug use, and polygamous nature.

This song can be considered a spiritual successor to “I don’t even speak spanish lol,” a mostly Spanish song from X’s sophomore studio album ?.

genius_description:
“Chicken Noodle Soup” is a collaboration between Latin-American artist Becky G and j-hope, member of Korean boy group BTS, interpolating a mutual “favorite childhood song”. Naver reports it charted #1 in 69 countries on Apple Music upon release.

It interpolates the classic 2006 hit song “Chicken Noodle Soup” by Webstar and Young B (feat. AG aka The Voice of Harlem). j-hope says the song’s accompanying dance is one of the first songs that helped him realize his passion for it.

The song is a celebration of global diversity and culture, showing pride in where they came from. They rap and sing about their homes and how they got to be where they are now. In this track, they bring three languages together. They both connect on a classic African-American hip-hop song.

The music video seconds this: it features j-hope and Becky G alongside more than 50 culturally-diverse dancers to showcase an explosive, sharp-set choreography.
genius_annotations:
[('Hope on the street', [['HOPE ON THE STREET is a video series by  j-hope posted via YouTube, Vlive and is now mainly posted on Twitter.

It first started September 20, 2015 with the post of Hope on the street @150920. To which j-hope danced to Make It Right by Lakita.

In the series, j-hope would film himself dancing and doing dance covers. He would dance different genres of music in various styles and was usually by himself but sometimes with accompanied by other members.



A few of the more popular videos would be #IdolChallenge and j-hope doing the #InMyFeelingsChallenge (which was featured in the official music video!)']]), ('금남 충장 street 거긴 내 할렘', [['Geum-nam Chung-jang Street, that’s my harlem

Both Webstar and Young B (Bianca Bonnie) of the original “Chicken Noodle Soup” (also featuring AG a.k.a. The Voice of Harlem) hails from the neighbourhood Harlem, New York City. The district is most closely associated with, and tied to, its African-American heritage.

J-Hope honorably acknowledges this by mentioning Geumnam Chungjang Street (Chungjang-ro) of his hometown Gwangju, South Korea, as “his Harlem.”']]), ('Chicken noodle soup
 Chicken noodle soup
 Chicken noodle soup with a soda on the side
 Chicken noodle soup
 Chicken noodle soup
 Chicken noodle soup with a soda on the side', [["While the chorus, like the song’s intro, outro, and bridge, all interpolate the lyrics and melody from Webstar’s 2006 hit, “Chicken Noodle Soup,” the choruses' melody in both versions seems to be taken directly from the Buckwheat Boyz smash hit, “Peanut Butter Jelly Time” and the subsequent, eponymous dancing banana meme in 2001.

Peanut butter jelly, peanut butter jelly
Peanut butter jelly wit' a baseball bat

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Z3ZAGBL6UBA"]]), ('Latinoamericana, soy de aquí', [['All four of Becky G’s grandparents are immigrants from Jalisco, Mexico, while her parents and most family were born in the United States.

She was born in Inglewood, California, and grew up partially in Moreno Valley. According to the US Census of 2010, Moreno Valley, California was approximately 54.4% hispanic; Inglewood: 50.6%.





Becky G’s grandfather and grandmother in 2012 from Becky G: Taking It Back to Inglewood on her official YouTube Channel.']]), ('[Verse 2: Becky G]', [["Becky G’s verse is mostly in Spanish and it translates into English as follows:

Chicken noodle, or chicken spaghetti
None of these women have the flow that Becky has
Latin American, I’m from here
Face of a saint, but freaky
Who will tell me what I’ve already seen? (Huh)
Where I was born, they didn’t think a woman was going to stand out
What you gonna do, what you gonna do? (What, what?)
What you gonna do, what you gonna do? (What, what?)
What you gonna do, what you gonna do? (What, what?)
What you gonna do, what you gonna do
Look back at it, lights, camera, action
Definitely the best on the scene
Word on the street, we got the people reactin'
People who criticize, I just feel sorry, haha"]]), ('I let it rain, I clear it out
 I let it rain, I clear it out
 I let it rain, I clear it out
 I let it rain, I clear it out', [["The chorus, bridge, intro, and outro’s lyrics and melody are a direct interpolation of Webstar and Young B’s “Chicken Noodle Soup” featuring AG aka The Voice of Harlem. As a member of BTS' rap line along with RM and Suga, j-hope has shown great interest in hip-hop. In fact, their group originally debuted with a hip-hop concept."]]), ('십대에 밤 새우며 성장한 case, ayy
 내 키는 춤으로 매겨 I’m okay, ayy', [['The translation provided in the subtitles for the music videos says

Grew being up all night as a teen, that’s the Case
My height is measured by dance, I’m okay

This is a reference to J-hope spending a large majority of his time as a teen without proper care and rest for his body, thanks to his work. This may have resulted in problems with growth, but he says that he doesn’t regret it, as he reaped rewards for all of his efforts and sleepless nights.']]), ('뉴런 입단 bounce with my team, ayy', [['Before debuting with BTS mid-2013, J-Hope was part of an underground street-dance team NEURON. Earliest videos found of him dancing with the crew date back as far to 2010.

J-Hope has talked about winning prizes in street-dance competitions, and fellow BTS member V (Kim Taehyung) had mentioned him in an interview with IZE on July 18, 2013:

“While enrolling at Korea Arts School, there were lots of trainees coming from different districts. When I debuted with BTS, my friends asked me, “J-Hope hyung, is he the one from that dance academy in Gwangju?” That’s how famous he was.”']]), ('늘 나를 채찍해 당근은 트로피에', [['Always whipping myself, the carrots are on the trophies

The popular idiom “dangle a carrot in front of one” comes from the allegory of a mule or a horse being baited with a carrot dangling from a string attached to a stick, which encourages it to move forward. In theory, it should work as means for consistent forward movement for the animal.

Put into the human context, this allegory serves to express J-Hope’s source of motivation in moving forward in his life, career, and altogether in constant artistic growth. Saying “the carrots are on the trophies” points to how awards and achievements (especially ones significant to his career), oftentimes literally trophies, are one out of many motivations he may have in moving forward and flourishing.

The expression of “whipping oneself” is a way to describe how one could be exceptionally hard on themselves, whether it be with full self-discipline or self-motivation to accelerate in completing a certain task. It is much like how a coachman of a carriage uses a whip on the horses upfront to increase or maintain speed.
So basically j-Hope conveys the point that he’s always ‘whipping himself’, or pushing himself forward toward those ‘carrots’ (The trophies which signify success and victory) through several means of hard work, self-enforced discipline and strict practice, which he relates to the word ‘whip’, an instantaneous slash of pain.

It is with these two interconnected metaphors he expresses his solemn, earnest drive to constantly grow as an individual and make progress to walk further down the road.']])]

genius_description:
“Babushka” is Russian for “grandmother” or “elderly woman,” and it’s also a type of Russian headscarf tied under the chin, traditionally worn by women from Eastern Europe. In November 2018, A$AP Rocky appeared at the LACMA Art+Film Gala in Los Angeles, wearing a $495 Gucci babushka.

Rocky revealed more details about the fashion choice—and the inspiration for the song—in January 2019. Apparently, the decision stemmed from a desire to hide a cut on his face, which he touches on throughout the song’s lyrics, referencing the classic 1983 gangster film Scarface. In January 2019, he told GQ magazine:

[The song] was inspired by a situation I had where my face got cut, and I started walking around with a babushka to cover it. It was about last September. It started with a yellow one when I was on Trevor Noah’s show. I actually did a Vogue shoot the day after I got my face slashed.

Rocky first previewed “Babushka Boi” during his 2019 Injured Generation tour.
genius_annotations:
[('Benjis in the safe (That’s right, ayy)', [['Benji is short for Benjamin Franklin.

The name is commonly used to refer to the US one hundred-dollar bill, in reference to the use of Franklin’s portrait on the print.']]), ('Praise to the Lord, give him grace', [['A callback to Flacko’s May 2018 hit “Praise the Lord (Da Shine)” featuring Skepta off his album TESTING:

Give thanks, get fresh, praise the Lord then finesse, bless']]), ('Uh, pearls and diamonds, that’s excessive', [['In February 2019, Rocky used this line as his caption on an Instagram post while out on his Injured Generation tour. During that time, he also performed an earlier version of the song, which did not include this outro.']]), ('Baked potato on that Draco, new bandana on my face', [['A common hoax is that a potato can be placed on the barrel of a firearm in order to silence it. However, it does not work, since the potato typically explodes or comes off the barrel of the weapon.

A Draco is a mini AK-47. Rocky has spoke on the gun before on his May 2018 track, “Gunz N Butter”:

Desi, FN, Ruger, Draco
Euros, pounds and dollars, pesos
Money, hoes and power, Draco
Violence, rifle, shotguns, Draco']]), ('Buck fifty, my babushka', [['“Buck fifty” is slang for $150, the price of Rocky’s headscarf. The term can also be used to describe a big scar on someones face, often from one corner of the mouth to the ear. The term originates from getting this wound stitched up with at least 150 stitches.

In September 2018, Rocky was cut on the face and it had to be covered, for which he used a babushka. “Babushka” is Russian meaning “grandmother” or “elderly woman,” but the term is also used to describe a Russian headscarf that is traditionally worn under the chin by elderly Eastern European women.

In a January 2019 interview with GQ, Rocky talked more about it:

It started with a yellow one when I was on Trevor Noah’s show. I actually did a Vogue shoot the day after I got my face slashed. […] It was inspired by Alfalfa—you ever see the Little Rascals, when he pretended to have a toothache? I kind of wanted to make it look like that. Basically on some shit so in case Trevor Noah asked me, I was just gonna be like, “I have a toothache.”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-sxrE2KPeFQ']]), ('They call me F-L-A-C-K-O and don’t play, no, ’bout my papes', [['Rocky has gone by the nickname Flacko since January 2012’s “Pretty Flacko,” and its January 2015 follow-up, “Lord Pretty Flacko Jodye 2 (LPFJ2)”. His handle on Twitter is also “LORD FLACKO JODYE II.”

“Papes” is shortened slang for paper, or money. According to Forbes‘ list of the top paid rappers in 2016, Rocky landed at number 13, having made $14.5 million.']]), ('Shit, I ain’t duck sauce since I became a vegan', [["Duck sauce is a popular condiment at Chinese-American restaurants. Although the ingredients in the dip are vegan—apricot, rice vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, ginger, chili powder, and cayenne powder—it is commonly used for dipping meat.

Rocky has always been open about his diets. In a May 2018 article with DJ Booth, he describes himself as vegetarian.

In Complex’s A$AP Rocky’s Guide to Harlem, the rapper breaks down his favorite stops and discusses animal cruelty:

I became a pescetarian a few months back. I started doing research and found out how they treat those animals before they, you know, service them. They inject them with steroids and drugs that enhance their growth. None of that shit is healthy, and on top of that those fucking animals were stressed and compressed the whole time. That kind of food going into your body is unhealthy. I don’t mean to sound like some weirdo, but it is what it is.

In a June 2018 article, Rocky also expressed his disapproval with the poultry industry:

You gotta go do research on the way they treat like fuckin' chickens, man. Those chickens go through fucking torture before they’re processed and shit, have all sorts of fucking steroids injected in them and everything."]]), ('Prada pants before the season', [['A$AP Rocky rocks Prada so often that he even calls himself “Prada Boy,” meaning he’s a both a fan and loyal customer.

Prada collaborated with Rocky to design custom outfits for his Injured Generation tour. Many of these pieces took design cues from Rocky’s popular “testing” theme.



 A Prada outfit designed for the Injured Generation Tour

Rocky also has a history of modeling for Prada and has been spotted wearing unreleased Prada clothing before the clothing collection has been released to the general public.']]), ('Smokin’ while I’m strollin’ down Wooster', [['Wooster Street is a street in SoHo, Manhattan and Greenwich Village that runs south to north from Canal Street to Washington Square. The street is home to many high-end fashion stores such as Gucci, Balmain, and Tiffany & Co., among many other brands.

Flacko is often seen in his home town of NYC cashing out on expensive clothing, while occasionally smoking a spliff.']]), ('Peep them teeth, no dentures please
 Princess cut, no dentist, please', [['A jewelry appraisal is a document received from a jewelry appraiser that describes the item and then gives a value for insurance purposes.

In 2017, Rocky iced out his back teeth with permanent diamonds.

https://streamable.com/ih01x

Additionally, Rocky can often be spotted wearing his diamond dentures.']])]

genius_description:
“Secreto” es una confesión de amor entre Karol G & Anuel AA donde admiten que han estado teniendo una relación secreta. Esta es su segunda canción juntos luego de “Culpables” hace unos meses.

Después de la primera colaboración, rumores empezaron a surgir de que si había una relación entre los artistas. Las sospechas fueron confirmadas cuando se dieron un beso en un concierto de Anuel en Nueva York.

Esta canción no fue anunciada de manera oficial, sin embargo, partes del tema empezaron a surgir en las redes. La canción fue filtrada por completo el 11 de diciembre del 2018, y lanzada oficialmente el 15 de enero del 2019.
genius_annotations: [('Y de tu cuerpo soy un tecato (-cato)', [['Tecato es una palabra peyorativa referida a drogadictos, mayormente de la heroína.\nAnuel se proclama tecato, o adicto, del cuerpo de Karol G.']])]

genius_description: “Night Falls” is the fourth song in Descendants 3. The song begins with the Descendants in battle against enchanted suits of armor, set on them by an evil Audrey. Mal and Uma begin to argue on whose battle plan to follow until Evie steps in to remind them that for the time being, they are on the same side and to put aside their differences in order to win this fight.
genius_annotations:
[('It doesn’t mean that we’re on the same side', [['On the surface, it just says that Uma’s group won’t become good just because of the battle, and that the VKs(the good ones: Mal’s crew) are still going to remain their enemies.
On the deeper understanding though, that means that they aren’t on the same side of the barrier that borders the Isle of the Lost and Auradon.']]), ('Suit of armor strong and true
 Make this metal bust a move!', [['Mal recites a spell on the knights to help win the battle. After this, the knights begin to copy her dance movements, then Uma’s and Carlos’s. Eventually, they lose formation and effectively knock themselves out.

The melodic yell during this section is reminiscent of “Immigrant Song” by Led Zeppelin.']]), ('Oh my gosh
 Look, guys, we’ve got bigger fish to fry', [['This could be a slight nod to Ursula’s Fish & Chips, the restaurant where Uma worked on the Isle. This spot was also home to one of the biggest numbers of Descendants 2, “What’s My Name.”']]), ('I got your back, got your back
 Got your back, got your back', [['This is the full realization of the cooperation arc; whereas first it was “Watch your back,” which expresses concern for each other but not involvement, and then it was “Back to back,” which implies cooperation in a mostly passive way, now it is “I got your back,” which suggests that they are actively cooperating and helping and protecting each other.']]), ('Back to back, back to back
 Back to back, back to back', [['Here, the refrain changes from “Watch your back” to “Back to back,” signaling that the group is becoming more cooperative over the course of the battle. Fighting back to back (though not reflected in the choreography) eliminates the need for each person to watch their own backs, because the person whose back is to theirs protects them by protecting themselves.']])]
