genius_annotations:
[('Yo no soy Don Omar, pero si el que to’ lo pega (¡Don!)', [['Don Omar suele referirse a sí mismo como “El que todo lo pega”, refrán que repite en varias canciones de su trayectoria, como “Si La Ves” y “Cae La Noche”.']]), ('Yo estaba encerrao’ en una celda, celda
 Por eso no espero que el tiempo vuelva (Yeh, yeh, yeh)', [['Anuel fue arrestado el día 3 de abril de 2016, y el 19 de junio de 2017 fue condenado a 30 meses en prisión federal por posesión de armas de fuego.

Durante su estadía en prisión, Doble A lanzó gran cantidad de temas, entre ellos una segunda versión de su sencilo “Ayer” llamada “Ayer 2” que contaba con la participación de Cosculluela, Nicky Jam y J Balvin. El 20 de junio de 2017, mientras Anuel aún se encontraba en prisión, la versión original de “Ayer” fue certificada como disco de platino por la RIAA.

El 17 de julio de 2018, Anuel fue liberado de prisión, y horas antes de su salida, el álbum sorpresa Real Hasta La Muerte vio la luz.

Al salir de prisión, Anuel AA ya era un artista con fama internacional, por lo que no tuvo necesidad de cantar en clubes nocturnos locales para darse a conocer como la mayoría de artistas, sino que empezó de primera mano a cantar en estadios internacionales, teniendo como ejemplo el Estadio Quisqueya en Santo Domingo, República Dominicana, que en mayo de 2019 llenó junto a su ahora prometida KAROL G.



Anuel AA vistiendo traje de reo.']]), ('Yo salgo y ninguno suenan, son como la H (Prr, prr, prr)', [['En el idioma español, la letra H no representa ningún sonido cuando está al inicio de una palabra, sin embargo sí lo produce cuando se encuentra en compañía de una letra C (dígrafo “ch”) o cuando se trata de un anglicismo, por ejemplo: “Hype” o “Hobby”.

Si se tratara de el último caso, la letra H se pronunciaría como una J suave.

Muestra inequívoca de que un artista o canción disfruta de éxito es ir fuera y escucharle sonar en cada esquina. Con esta barra Bad Bunny asegura que a su competencia no le está yendo nada bien en ese aspecto, puesto que no les escucha sonar cuando sale a la calle.']]), ('It’s Payday, fellas', [['La etiqueta del productor Payday viene de un live action del videojuego PAYDAY 2, donde el personaje Hoxton, interpretado por el actor Josh Lenn, es rescatado.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fUm3oxLbyRM']]), ('Michael Phelps tirao’ pa’ atrá’, nadando en mi’ millone’', [['Michael Phelps es un ex-nadador de competición estadounidense. Es conocido por ser el deportista olímpico más condecorado de la historia, contando con un total de 22 medallas de oro.

Benito menciona a Phelps para hacer referencia a que tiene tanto dinero en efectivo, que incluso podría llenar una piscina con billetes y nadar entre ellos.



Michael Phelps posando con sus medallas.']]), ('LeBron James, cabrón, yo juego toa’ la’ posicione’ (Huh)', [['LeBron James es un jugador de baloncesto estadounidense que actualmente juega en Los Angeles Lakers de la NBA. Es considerado uno de los mejores jugadores del deporte debido a su dominancia y liderazgo.

No es la primera vez que Bad Bunny menciona a LeBron en sus canciones, ya lo ha hecho en otras ocasiones en el pasado, en temas como “Tú No Metes Cabra”, “Estamos Clear”, “Tu No Vive Así”, entre otros.

Comparándose con James, y diciendo que “juega todas las posiciones”, Benito hace referencia a que puede hacer cualquier actividad por su cuenta sin ayuda de terceros, y a su habilidad de cantar distintos estilos musicales, como se ha visto en temas como “Amorfoda”, “Flor” o “Soy El Diablo (Remix)”.



LeBron James junto a algunos de sus trofeos.']]), ('Salí pa’l jet directo desde la nevera (Brr)', [['Anuel relata su salida de prisión, en la cuál estuvo encárcelado por supuesta posesión ilegal de armas de fuego desde el 3 de abril de 2016 hasta el 12 de mayo de 2018.

Primeramente nos establece una comparación entre una cárcel y una nevera, siendo que las dos, comúnmente, son una caja de cuatro paredes donde se mantiene el frío.

Como también es de público conocimiento, Anuel es propietario de una gran fortuna, incluso estando preso el seguía cobrando dinero por sus canciones. Es por esto mismo que relata que al momento de salir de prisión fue directo a un jet privado']]), ('¿Oíste, bebecita? Jaja', [['Anuel usó el término “bebecita” en una canción por primera vez en el segundo verso de su canción “Ayer” lanzada el 13 de noviembre de 2015, pero no fue hasta a partir de la repercusión que tuvo el uso por Anuel del término en “BEBE” del rapero estadounidense 6ix9ine, que empezó a utilizar el término en la mayoría de sus canciones como firma.

Con esta frase, Anuel podría estar enviándole un saludo a KAROL G, su prometida, a quien ya se ha referido como “bebecita” en otros temas, siendo el más destacado su tema colaborativo de 2019, “Secreto”.



Anuel AA y KAROL G.']]), ('Sonando diferente, Yaga y Mackie (Yaga y Mackie)', [['Referencia al álbum Sonando Diferente del dúo puertorriqueño Yaga y Mackie, lanzado el año 2002.']]), ('Los tengo sin anillo como Jordan a Charles Barkley (Wu-huh)', [['Bad Bunny hace referencia a las finales de la NBA de 1993, donde se enfrentaron el Chicago Bulls de Michael Jordan contra el Phoenix Suns de Charles Barkley.

El equipo de Jordan se quedó con el anillo de campeón de la NBA, luego de 3 victorias de los Bulls contra 2 victorias del equipo de Phoenix.
De esta manera, Benito relata el arrebato del anillo de campeón hacia Barkley, dado que nunca ha ganado ninguno pese a pertenecer al Basketball Hall of Fame (En español, Salón de la Fama del Baloncesto).

Benito hace una analogía de su vida con este evento, para decir que está por encima de todos los demás artistas de la escena latinoamericana.



Michael Jordan y Charles Barkley, finales de la NBA, 1993.']])]

genius_description:
“MOOD 4 EVA” is the twelfth track on Beyoncé’s specially-curated The Lion King accompaniment  project, The Gift, and functions as a celebratory anthem. It features JAY-Z and her Lion King co-star, Childish Gambino, as well as a tropical afrobeat instrumental produced by Just Blaze and DJ Khaled.

The song samples Grammy Award-winning Malian songstress Oumou Sangaré’s classic 1989 love song, titled “Diaraby Nene”:

https://youtu.be/i_Sid8WDOno
genius_annotations:
[('My baby father, bloodline Rwanda', [['Beyoncé’s husband Jay-Z has Rwandan blood, she is speaking  about his ancestors being for the most of them Rwandans']]), ('Treasures dancin’ on the bezel', [['A bezel is a hoop/circle setting that holds gems in jewelry. Treasures, meaning gems. Her gems are of such high quality, that their sparkle makes it look like they are dancing.']]), ('Together, we big timin’
 The children are our reminder', [['Beyonce uses this line to reference the power that her relationship with Jay-Z possesses.

Beyonce and Jay-Z have three children together, Blue Ivy, Sir, and Rumi.



Before she gave birth to Blue, Beyonce experienced a miscarriage. This tragedy, along with the birth of her 3 other children has connected Beyonce with motherhood, a theme that has become prominent in her more recent music.

In Life Is But a Dream, Beyonce talks about the impact pregnancy has had on her:

“[It was] the most beautiful experience of my life. It was amazing. I felt like God was giving me a chance to assist in a miracle. You’re playing a part in a much bigger show. And that’s what life is. It’s the greatest show on Earth.”

The three amazing children she has created with her husband, Jay-Z, are arguably the greatest achievement in the artist’s life. She explains that the children are a constant reminder of the power and beauty her relationship with Jay-Z holds.']]), ('I got my cup up to the heavens
 Another night I won’t remember', [['In this lyric when she says cup she is referring to an alcoholic beverage. When people consume a large amount of alcohol they they may get a headache and not remember the time she was drinking. So she is saying lets have fun now even though we will not remember this night']]), ('I done leveled up, now my view panoramic', [['In this lyric she gave leveled up a double meaning.   One is she now has reached a new level of power, the second is she is in a higher place on earth so she can see can see everything https://www.google.com/search?q=panoramic&safe=strict&rlz=1C1CHBF_enUS864US865&sxsrf=ALeKk03RWlgQI1Z1pExZy00heJpY7U15AQ:1596475925348&tbm=isch&source=iu&ictx=1&fir=G-K5uG7a3ygSqM%252CxLsF5tEwTIVd6M%252C%252Fm%252F017rtb&vet=1&usg=AI4_-kShHUf0S5nFbe98Hf-X3iWvt-g7PA&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwjnuLCjyP_qAhUDhXIEHZrhCTwQ_B0wIXoECAQQAw#imgrc=G-K5uG7a3ygSqM']]), ('I threw up my diamond', [['Jay-Z often makes a hand sign that forms a diamond shape to reference to his record label, Roc-A-Fella Records. “Rock” is a common slang term for diamonds, so using the hand symbol is widely known as “throwing up the roc.”']]), ('Ankh on my gold chain', [['The ankh, otherwise known as the “key of life” is an ancient Egyptian hieroglyphic symbol commonly used in art and writing to represent the word for “life.” By extension, it also worked as a symbol of life itself. Gods or goddesses were often portrayed holding ankhs towards pharaohs, representing their ability to sustain and revive life.



Beyoncé’s has born an ankh necklace herself in the past, including in the “DON’T HURT YOURSELF” video section of Lemonade. The symbol may serve protective or good luck functions for her, and certainly indicate a sense of power.']]), ('Piña colada-in’, you stay Ramada Inn', [['With this line, Beyoncé is poking fun at her “broke haters” by showing off her wealth. Pina coladas are a typical exotic alcoholic beverage drank on vacations and beach areas. While Beyoncé has the financial stability to lounge around on expensive vacations, her “haters” stay in Ramada Inn, an international hotel chain generally known for its low price point (and questionable room quality).']]), ('I am the Nala,', [['Beyoncé, while curating this album for The Lion King movie, is also lending her voice to the character of Nala, who is young Simba’s best friend and ultimately his wife.
The name Nala comes from the Swahili language and means Chance. In some regions, it also means “princess warrior” stemming from the nile from the most high, the gift.']]), ('Why would you try me? Why would you bother?
 I am Beyoncé Giselle Knowles-Carter', [['There is no point in coming after, or “trying,” Queen B. She has cemented herself as a music legend with nothing left to prove. She uses her full name here to emphasize her status and remind people to not get on her bad side.']])]

genius_primary_artist: Blue Ivy, SAINt JHN, Beyoncé & Wizkid
genius_description:
With help from Wizkid, SAINt JHN and her own daughter Blue Ivy Carter, Beyoncé uses “BROWN SKIN GIRL” to tell young “brown skinned” girls to be proud of their skin and embrace it.

The track serves as the 4th “collab” between Ivy and Beyoncé, with some of the songs being “Blue” and “Wake Up”. This is the first time that JHN, Wizkid and Beyoncé have ever worked together in any way.
genius_annotations:
[('Gold like 24K, okay', [['The Carat (Karat) unit is used to measure the purity of gold alloys; not to be confused with Carat for diamonds.

Because pure gold is too soft and pliable to be used for jewelry, ornaments and tools, it is usually mixed with other metals like copper, silver, platinum etc. The Carat system is then used to determine how much gold an alloy contains; a gold Karat is 1/24 part of a whole alloy.

For example; an object that measures 18K contains 18 parts of gold and 6 parts of alloying metal(s); 24K is therefore 24 parts of gold out of 24 parts of the object, which would make the object 100% pure gold.

Gold also features in The Lion King: The Gift album cover art, the art depicts two gold lions (Simba and Scar) tied together in a circle. The colour might be inspired by the yellow-gold colour of the lion. It can also be to represent the superior status lions have among other animals as it is seen in the The Lion King film.']]), ('Melanin too dark to throw her shade (Shade)', [['To “throw shade” means to criticize someone often in a subtle manner. Rather than take any disrespect, Beyoncé  references melanin, a natural pigment which serves as the primary factor in determining human skin color.

In addition to protecting skin cells from harmful ultraviolet sun rays, higher levels of melanin in Beyoncé’s eyes also serve as a source of pride counter to any criticism. Here, “shade” could also mean the blocking of sunlight, representing a dark color that, for Beyoncé, is still lighter than one’s skin color.

During ABC’s The Lion King: Can You Feel the Love Tonight special, Beyoncé described the power of melanin in reference to the debut release of the music video for “Spirit,” another track off of The Lion King: The Gift:

It’s the beauty of color, the beauty of melanin, the beauty of tradition.']]), ('Same skin that was broken
 Be the same skin takin’ over', [['Bey contrasts the way Black skin was literally broken by whips during the era of slavery in America between 1619 and 1865, to the rising power of Black people in the very same country.']]), ('I love everything about you, from your nappy curls
 To every single curve, your body natural', [['A “nappy curl” or coiled, curly hair is hair in its natural state, and is a common trait amongst Black people.

Bey has publicly celebrated Black womanhood over the years. Celebratory themes about hair and curves can be found, for example, on her February 2016 track, “FORMATION”:

I like my baby heir with baby hair and afros

She also proclaimed on June 2018’s “BLACKEFFECT”:

Stunt with your curls, your lips, Sarah Baartman hips']]), ('She need an Oscar for that pretty dark skin', [["Beyonce’s work as the curator of The Lion King soundtrack, and her writing and producer credits on its lead single, “Spirit,” represented another opportunity for her to receive her first Oscar nomination and win. While the songwriters and producers of Bey’s song “Listen” from the 2006 film Dreamgirls were nominated in the Best Original Song category, Bey did not receive a nomination because she did not help compose or produce the song. While “Spirit” was shortlisted for the 92nd Academy Awards, it did not receive a nomination, a decision that Billboard declared “a glaring snub.”



The mention of Oscars also foreshadows her mention of Lupita Nyong'o in the following line, who won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress in 2014 for her performance in 12 Years a Slave."]]), ('Pretty like Lupita when the cameras close in', [["Lupita Nyong'o is a Kenyan-Mexican, Oscar award-winning actress. She was named Glamour’s 2014 Woman of the Year and People’s 2014 Most Beautiful. Lupita responded to Bey with this tweet:

https://twitter.com/Lupita_Nyongo/status/1152269165534707713?ref_src=twsrc%5Egoogle%7Ctwcamp%5Enews%7Ctwgr%5Etweet"]]), ('Drip broke the levee when my Kellys roll in', [['Bey plays on the last name of her longtime friend, Kelly Rowland. Kelly has been very vocal about struggling to love her dark skin while growing up. She told CNikky.com:

You know what I had great women in my life to help me overcome that. I remember I went through a period where I didn’t embrace my ‘chocolatiness.’ I don’t know if that’s a word, but I didn’t embrace my chocolate lifestyle. Just being a chocolate, lovely brown skin girl and being proud of that. I remember Tina Knowles, Bey’s mom and I remember being out in the sun and I was trying to shield myself from the sun and she said, ‘Are you crazy?’ She said ‘You are absolutely gorgeous’ and she just told me how beautiful I was and how rare chocolate is and how gorgeous the skin is, all of this stuff. And I was just like ‘Yeah!’ Like a light went off. So between her and my mother and then me sitting out in the sun a little more, just to be a little more chocolate. You just embrace it. You embrace everything that you are as a woman, even your flaws too.']]), ('Pose like a trophy when Naomi’s walkin’', [['Naomi Campbell is an English supermodel of Jamaican descent. She started her career in 1978 and achieved international success in the 1980s and 1990s.']])]

genius_primary_artist: The Black Eyed Peas & J Balvin
genius_description:
Working off of near and far nostalgia-inducing samples, the American and Colombian artists boast their party lifestyles on “RITMO (Bad Boys For Life)” for people to envy as they also include references to both nostalgic and newer pop culture.

The Black Eyed Peas continue to collaborate with Latin artists, as seen before on “Mami” with Piso 21 and “eXplosion” with Anitta. This time, they recruit J Balvin, the Latin trailblazer, to fill the missing piece of their puzzle.

The catchy chorus and instrumental bridge, sampled from DJ Snake and AlunaGeorge’s “You Know You Like It”, help to craft this multicultural hit that pays homage to its references and samples.
genius_annotations:
[('You like that space?', [['This part was removed from the album version.']]), ('Lo que se ve, no se pregunta (Na’)', [['[Español]

J Balvin hace mención de una famosa frase que hizo muy popular el artista mexicano Juan Gabriel, con el cual colaboró en el 2015 para su álbum Los dúo 2 con una nueva versión de la canción “La Frontera”.
“Lo que se ve, no se pregunta” es una frase que se hizo famosa en el año 2003 cuando el periodista Fernando del Rincón del programa Primer Impacto le cuestionó a Juan Gabriel por unas fotos que circulaban de él junto a un joven, cuestionando así la orientación sexual del artista, la frase surgió a raíz de que el periodista le preguntó de manera directa si era gay, a lo que Juan Gabriel contestó “Dicen que lo que se ve, no se pregunta mijo”, haciendo así importar esa frase, tanto que al día de hoy cuenta con su propia imagen de meme.

  


[English]

J Balvin mentions a famous phrase that was made very popular by the Mexican artist Juan Gabriel, with whom he collaborated in 2015 for his album Los dúo 2 with a new version of the song “La Frontera”.
“Lo que se ve, no se pregunta” is a sentence that became famous in 2003 when journalist Fernando del Rincón of the program Primer Impacto questioned Juan Gabriel about some photos that were circulating of him next to a young man, questioning the artist’s sexual orientation. The journalist asked him directly if he was gay, to which Juan Gabriel replied “Dicen que lo que se ve, no se pregunta mijo” (meaning “What is seen does not need to be asked” or “Don’t ask questions you already know the answer to”), thus immortalizing the phrase: so much so that today he has his own meme image.']]), ('Live it up, hit ’em up, that’s the scenario (2Pac)', [['[English]

“Hit ‘em Up” is a famous diss track by the American rapper 2Pac, which contains many different harsh insults that target other rappers.

  


[Español]

“Hit ‘em Up” es una canción del rapero estadounidense 2Pac, la cual contiene insultos crueles a otros raperos.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=41qC3w3UUkU']]), ('La Rosalía me dice que luzco guay (La Rosalía)', [['[Español]

Rosalía es una cantante española con la que J Balvin colaboró en la canción “Con Altura” y antes en su álbum Vibras con la canción “Brillo”. Ambos artistas son conocidos por su extravagante y elaborado estilo de vestir.



[English]

Rosalía is a Spanish singer with whom J Balvin collaborated in the song “Con Altura” and before on his album Vibras with the song “Brillo”. Both artists are known for their eye-catching and elaborate clothing style.']]), ('Como Canelo en el ring nada me asusta', [['[Español]

Balvin se refiere a Saúl Álvarez, el boxeador mexicano conocido como El Canelo. Canelo es considerado como uno de los mejores boxeadores con 52 ganadas de 55 peleas.



[English]

Balvin references Saúl Álvarez, the Mexican boxer known as El Canelo. Canelo is considered to be one of the best boxers, with 52 wins out of 55 fights.']]), ('That’s how we do it, we buildin’ like LEGOs (Oh, yeah)', [['[English]

In reference to the famous Danish construction toys.

It’s not the first iteration in a BEP song, as in “XOXOXO”, Apl.de.ap sings:

I wanna stay connected like Lego

  


[Español]

En referencia a los famosos juguetes de construcción daneses.

No es la primera iteración en una canción de los BEP, en “XOXOXO”, Apl.de.ap cantaba:

I wanna stay connected like Lego

https://youtu.be/-qD3f-iNxJo?t=101']]), ('No son ni Reebok ni son Nike (No)', [['[Español]

J Balvin hace referencia a un clip de audio de una estación de radio en que un oyente de la estación preguntó al presentador sobre la canción “The Rhythm of the Night” de Corona. El oyente creyó que la canción decía: “Esos son Reebok o son Nike”.

“RITMO (Bad Boys For Life)” samplea esa canción, y por eso J Balvin dice que no son ni Reebok ni son Nike de una manera de broma.

  


[English]

J Balvin is referencing an audio clip from a radio station in which a listener asked the host about the song “The Rhythm of the Night”, from the band Corona. The listener thought that the song said: “Are these Reebok or Nike”.

“RITMO (Bad Boys For Life)” samples this song, so J Balvin uses this line to explain that it doesn’t say Reebok or Nike, in a joking manner.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BQ4c54rCJ_k

Video de la emisión en la radio cuando se dió el clip.




Video of the radio broadcast and referenced audio.']]), ('Hakuna Matata como Timón y Pumba', [['[Español]

Timón y Pumba son un dúo de la película animada, El rey león. J Balvin refiere a la canción que canta el dúo, “Hakuna Matata”. En realidad, “hakuna matata” es una frase swahili que significa “sin preocupaciones” o “sin problemas.” Balvin, como Timón y Pumba, no está preocupado por nada.

  


[English]

Timon and Pumbaa are a duo from the animated film The Lion King. J Balvin references “Hakuna Matata”, the well known song that the duo sings in the film. “Hakuna matata” is a Swahili saying that means “no worries” or “no problems”. Balvin, by being like Timon and Pumbaa, doesn’t have any worries.']])]

genius_description:
“Over Now” is a single by Calvin Harris and The Weeknd, released on August 28, 2020, alongside its accompanying official music video. This track marks the first collaboration between the two artists. “Over Now” is Harris' first song under his name since 2019’s “Giant.”

On this upbeat track, Abel sings about letting go of a failed relationship for the better, stating that it was hard to get along in the relationship. He also says that both him and this girl use drugs to cope with the stress of the relationship. He expresses his feelings for the relationship throughout the track.

It was first previewed during Abel’s virtual TikTok concert on August 7, 2020. On August 20, he posted a picture of himself and Calvin Harris at Coachella 2014 on Instagram, teasing the line “Don‘t get too confused.” The track was officially announced by both artists on August 22, along with promotional posters.
genius_annotations:
[('Feedin’ the press, when we don’t speak
 But we’re both with somebody else
 So please stop callin’ me', [['It’s no surprise that paparazzi pries on celebrities private lives. Abel is tired of these press asking him private questions and rapidly being under the spotlight, with stories about his relationships and wants to move on once and for all.

In 2015, he’s spotted dating former supermodel, Bella Hadid  after they were seen flirting each other at Coachella, and since breaking up in November 2016. Then in January 2017, he started dating American singer-songwriter Selena Gomez, whom they eventually split up at October 2017. It was until April 2018, he reconciled with Bella Hadid after he was seen leaving Hadid’s apartment and kissing, but broke up again in August 2019.



During the times, The Weeknd has been followed non-stop by media just to get a glimpse of his love life with other stars. In a Billboard interview, he opens up how it feels about “Dealing with paparazzi all the time.”


I go out, and they’re there sometimes, but I don’t tell the whole world I’m going out…They literally followed me from Beverly Hills all the way down to Hollywood. I respect the paparazzi, it’s their job, I got no beef with them.

I don’t need pictures of me being generated all the time.']]), ('But you always need that attention', [['Abel’s lover’s need for attention in a relationship is a theme he’s already touched on in his discography. In his 2016 album, Starboy, the chorus of the thirteenth track, “Attention” centres on the fact:

You’re only looking for attention
You only notice it cause I’m never around
You’re only looking for attention, oh, oh
You’re only looking for attention
The only problem is you’ll never get enough
You’re only looking for attention, oh, oh']]), ('So, I take this just to forget you
 I don’t regret those memories', [["Abel alludes to taking drugs to numb his pain and forget his former lover. He makes a similar remark on “Faith”, singing:

I’ve been sober for a year, now it’s time for me
To go back to my old ways, don’t you cry for me

Additionally, Abel talks about returning to drugs after his break up with Selena Gomez on his 2018 track “Privilege”:

But I'ma drink the pain away, I’ll be back to my old ways
And I got two red pills to take the blues away, oh"]]), ('I don’t really care if your tears fall down your face', [['This shows a big contrast to the earlier 2020 Weeknd song “Save Your Tears” off his fourth studio album After Hours. As the song’s title already explains, Abel wanted his lover to certainly not be sad or cry, which could have happened while thinking about their complicated relationship.

Save your tears for another day

However, he managed to let go of their relationship, hence he doesn’t care anymore.']]), ('I need you to know that
 We ain’t ever gonna go back
 This time, it got so bad
 It’s best for me, it’s best for you
 I need you to know that
 Tried to love you, but I forced that
 All signs, we ignored that
 And it’s not the same', [['Abel is seemingly hinting that he is over his break-up with Bella Hadid. This connects with the narrative of his fourth studio album, After Hours, which was released in March 2020. Throughout the album, Abel apologizes to his significant other, like on “Scared To Live,” and he accepts the end of a relationship on “Until I Bleed Out”:

I wanna cut you outta my dreams

Abel also sang and wrote an apology letter to his significant other with “Final Lullaby,” the last track off of the deluxe version, which finds him making peace with a broken relationship:

And I can’t make you stay
In this broken place
And I hope you find peace
Close your eyes as I put us to sleep

It’s also worth noting that there is a difference in the overall tone of this song in comparison to the songs on After Hours; this track is less somber due to its funk-pop backdrop, which is reminiscent of the sounds Abel applied on his sophomore studio album, Beauty Behind the Madness, which was released exactly five years before this track.']])]

genius_description:
“WAP” (Wet-Ass Pussy) is Cardi B’s fourth number 1 hit on Billboard, her first release of 2020, and her first single since 2019’s “Press.” It is expected to appear on her upcoming second studio album and marks her first collaboration with Megan Thee Stallion.

The track is built around a bass-heavy trap beat and a looping sample of DJ Frank Ski’s “Whores In This House.” The song’s raunchy lyrics detail Cardi and Megan’s sexual fantasies.

According to Cardi, the song is so explicit Atlantic Records was worried about its release, and even asked Cardi to put Megan on a different song:

When [the label] heard the song they were like, “We really like it, but that song is so explicit.” … They were like, “Can you please get another record and you could put Megan on it?” And I was like, “No.”

Like other sex-positive songs by female artists, these lyrics sparked online controversy. However, they were also widely praised for their message of female empowerment and sexual liberation.

The pair first revealed the song on August 3, 2020, with an announcement that the music video would premiere alongside its release three days later.

genius_description:
“GREECE” is one of the dual lead singles—along with “POPSTAR”—from DJ Khaled’s twelfth studio album, KHALED KHALED. Both tracks feature Drake and are Khaled’s first releases since his May 2019 album, Father of Asahd.

On the song, Drake promises his significant other a luxurious lifestyle, including vacations to Greece and expensive clothing. He then switches up the mood at the end of the song, where he discusses relationship problems that stem from his wealth and status.

The song was first previewed during an Instagram Live session Drake had on May 1, 2020, the day his fifth commercial mixtape, Dark Lane Demo Tapes, was released. Two months later, on June 30, 2020, Khaled and Drake both posted pictures of owls—the symbol of Drake’s OVO Sound imprint—teasing a possible collaboration between them. On July 15, 2020, Khaled posted the song’s release date and cover art on his Instagram account.
genius_annotations:
[('We The Best Music
 Another one
 DJ Khaled', [['These are DJ Khaled’s trademark slogans that he often proclaims in the intro and outro of his songs. We the Best Music Group is a record label imprint of Epic Records that was founded by Khaled in 2008.

“Another one” is Khaled’s signature way of announcing that he has another hit on his hands.']]), ('Long time lookin’ for the bounce, yeah
 OZ had the bounce, yeah', [['OZ is a notable producer from Zurich, Switzerland who has worked with Drake on many occasions.

The reasoning for his shoutout is that “Greece” was originally OZ’s track, who produced and recorded his own version with German lyrics. After he posted a few now-deleted snippets of it on Instagram, Drake commented under his post saying “drop Greece.”

However, Drake later decided to record his own version of the song.']]), ('She can’t help but get attached', [['On his September 2013 song, “The Language,” Drake mentions how he isn’t a fan of girls getting too attached to him:

And she way too attached to me
Hate when they get too attached to me

He similarly follows on his July 2018 “Behind Barz” freestyle:

Can’t do love ‘cause they get too attached']]), ('Gone out to Caicos, she can stay in my room
 She can stay in my room, and it ain’t my', [['“Caicos,” short for Turks and Caicos, is a group of islands in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of the United States.

Drake has been seen out in the islands many times. In December 2018 and May 2019, he posted pictures at a villa and on a patio at the destination, respectively. His private jet, known as Air Drake, was seen at a private airport on the island sometime after the Toronto Raptors—Drake’s hometown team—won the NBA championship in June 2019.

He previously mentioned the island on his May 2020 track “Pain 1993” where he boasted he has a beachfront mansion there:

I just got a mansion out in Turks and it’s a beachfront']]), ('Full speed, je suis ton génie', [['“Je suis ton génie” is French for “I am your genie.” A genie is a spirit or imaginary creature that appears when you rub a magic lamp and grant wishes. Drake compares himself to a genie as he provides his woman with lavish trips and luxury clothing.']]), ('Speedboats, baby, in Nikki Beach
 Waves in my ears, smokin’ weed (Oui, oui)
 Whippin’ through the sand in a Jeep (Oui, oui)
 All because of what I did on beats, baby', [['Nikki Beach Worldwide is a luxury beach club brand that has locations worldwide, including in Greece. However, it’s possible that Drake’s talking about the Miami location as speedboats are a common sight in Miami.

Notably, Nikki Beach is also a frequent spot for Sophie Brussaux—the mother of Drake’s child, Adonis—as in December 2019, she was seen at the Morocco location during a vacation with some friends.']]), ('Come with me, leave all of your things, yeah
 We can stop at Gucci, stop at Louis V, yeah
 Come with me, fly you out to Greece
 Full speed, survoler Paris, yeah', [['Greece is a country located in southeastern Europe, known for its beaches, resorts, archeological sites, and whitewashed villages—making it a notable vacation spot for Drake and his woman.

“Survoler Paris” is French for “fly over Paris.” With Drake being from Toronto, Canada, it’s possible he may fly over France—with Paris being its capital city—while on his way to Greece.

Gucci and Louis Vuitton are both expensive luxury clothing brands. Notably, both brands have stores located on the Greek island, Mykonos and in Athens, the capital city of Greece.']]), ('Life’s sweet, baby, on a G-Wag', [['The G-Wagon is a G-Class SUV produced by the luxurious German automobile brand Mercedes-Benz. Their 2020 models are priced well over $100,000, making it one of the most expensive SUVs on the market.

In February 2019, Drake purchased a Mercedes-Maybach G650 Landaulet—a nicer rendition of the G-Wagon—for over $500,000. Notably, at the time of its purchase, it was reportedly the only one to exist in North America. After the purchase, Drake’s friend, Tony Bet went to Instagram to boast about the vehicle and its exclusivity.



Drake’s Mercedes G650 Landaulet']]), ('Rolls Royce, baby, in Hidden Hills', [['Rolls-Royce is a popular British brand of luxury cars. In November 2019, Drake bought a custom-made, one of a kind Rolls-Royce Phantom for a reported $700,000.

The custom changes include a Bushukan yellow finish with a signature two-tone paint scheme, courtesy of Mansory—a luxury car modification company. Aside from that, the Rolls-Royce’s signature Spirit of Ecstasy bonnet ornament was replaced with a gold owl, which has two large diamonds that make up the owl’s eyes, that has Drake’s full name—Aubrey Drake Graham—engraved in it.

The brain-child behind the design none other than Drake’s friend and vehicle designer, Tony Bet, who unveiled the car on his Instagram:

https://www.instagram.com/p/B41aYtXpaEj/?utm_source=ig_embed

The Hidden Hills is an upscale, gated community located north of Los Angeles. It’s home to many celebrities including Drake himself, Kanye West, The Weeknd, French Montana, Angelina Jolie, Kylie Jenner—and the rest of the Kardashian/Jenner clan—and many others.']])]

genius_description:
“POPSTAR” is one of the dual lead singles—along with “GREECE”—from DJ Khaled’s twelfth studio album, KHALED KHALED. Both tracks feature Drake and are Khaled’s first releases since his May 2019 album, Father of Asahd.

On the song, Drake likens himself to a pop star and the lifestyle that comes with being one—girls calling him nonstop, sporting credit cards with high spending limits, and buying large numbers of expensive watches. He also name-drops pop singers Ariana Grande, Selena Gomez and Justin Bieber, adding to the “pop star” theme of the song.

On June 30, 2020, Khaled and Drake both posted pictures of owls—the symbol of Drake’s OVO Sound imprint—teasing a possible collaboration between them. On July 15, 2020—two days before the song’s official release—Khaled posted the song’s release date and cover art on his Instagram account.

On September 4, 2020, the song’s official music video was released. Justin Bieber, who’s mentioned in the song, makes a cameo in the video and acts as a stand-in for Drake.

[('I want a quick death (Yeah), and an easy one (Yeah)

It’s an Irish toast also']]), ('Shit don’t even usually get this big without a Bieber face', [['Drake gives a shoutout to fellow Canadian artist, Justin Bieber. He acts as a stand-in for Drake in the song’s official music video, which was released almost two months after the single’s initial release.

With these lines, Drake’s likely saying it’s not easy to get to his level of popularity without a “Bieber” or a handsome face as handsome artists get a lot of attention, especially from their female fans. Also, Justin Bieber is a pop singer, which adds to the “popstar” theme of the song.

In the first verse, Drake mentions Bieber’s manager, Scooter Braun, who is in part responsible for Justin’s fame and success, marking a connection between the two lines.']]), ('I’m a popstar, but this shit ain’t bubblegum, yeah', [["Bubblegum pop is generic, upbeat pop music that’s mainly marketed towards children or young adults. It originated in the late ‘60s and was popular through the early '70s before other genres like disco and punk rock emerged.

Drake has been questioned on whether he’s a rapper or a pop singer throughout his career due to his frequent use of mixing melodic singing and rapping together, which leads many people to discredit his bars and status as a rapper. However, he is the top selling solo male artist of all time in America, which gives him the celebrity and status of a pop star.

Although he may not have the gritty or trap style of other popular rappers, his pop-like songs—July 2015’s “Hotline Bling” for example—would not be considered bubblegum music as he points out here."]]), ('Two, four, six, eight watches, factory, so they appreciate', [['This line is a play on the commonly known cheer, “2, 4, 6, 8… Who do we appreciate?” However, Drake’s playing on the word “appreciate” as it also denotes an increase in the value of an asset over time.

Drake has an extensive watch collection that he buys in stock form directly from the factory. Each one appreciates in value, perhaps merely by association with the artist. A notable watch to join his collection is his one-of-a-kind Patek Philippe Nautilus, designed by Off-White founder and Louis Vuitton artistic director Virgil Abloh. In January 2020, Drake debuted the watch on his Instagram page.']]), ('Naw, naw, piece of cake, naw, naw, Turks and Caic’, yeah, yeah', [['Turks and Caicos is a group of 40 islands in the Atlantic Ocean, southeast of the Bahamas.

Drake has been known to be a visitor to the islands; in May 2019, he debuted his custom Boeing 767 airplane, named Air Drake, at the island of Providenciales. In June 2019, Drake was seen on the islands in “album mode,” preparing for his sixth studio album.



Drake also name-drops the islands on “Greece,” the other DJ Khaled collaboration released on July 17, 2020:

Gone out to Caicos, she can stay in my room']]), ('Yeah, last year, I kept it on the tuck, ayy
 2020, I came to fuck it up, yeah', [['In 2019, Drake had a low-key year, only releasing three new songs: June 2019’s “Money in the Grave” and “Omertà”—both released apart of his The Best in the World Pack EP—and December 2019’s “War.” While not a new track, in September 2019, Drake re-released “Behind Barz” on streaming platforms, a freestyle he originally performed in July 2018 for the British rap platform Link Up TV.

Moving into 2020, Drake has already released a number one hit, April 2020’s “Toosie Slide” and a commercial mixtape, Dark Lane Demo Tapes. His sixth studio album was also due for a summer 2020 release but was later delayed indefinitely.']]), ('We The Best Music
 Another one (Yeah)
 DJ Khaled', [['These are DJ Khaled’s trademark slogans that he often proclaims in the intro and outro of his songs. We the Best Music Group is a record label imprint of Epic Records that was founded by Khaled in 2008.

“Another one” is Khaled’s signature way of announcing that he has another hit on his hands.']]), ('If we talkin’ joints, it’s just me and David Foster', [['Drake pays an ode to fellow Canadian musician, songwriter and composer David Foster.

Foster was first credited in 1972 and has continued to make music of his own and help others throughout multiple decades. He has worked with other talents such as Diana Ross, Céline Dion, Whitney Houston, Madonna, Michael Jackson, Lionel Richie, and more.

On top of having sixteen Grammy awards and a Golden Globe under his belt, Foster was inducted into the Canadian Music Hall of Fame in 2007 and has also been inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame.

One of Foster’s most famous production credits was Whitney Houston’s 1992 version of “I Will Always Love You” from “The Bodyguard” soundtrack.

The film starred Houston and Kevin Costner, who Drake deliberately references in the next two lines. Costner, a co-producer on the film, was the one that suggested to Foster that he rearrange the original Dolly Parton song for Houston to sing.']]), ('Look, Ariana, Selena, my Visa
 It can take as many charges as it needs to, my girl
 That shit platinum just like all of my releases, my girl', [['Continuing with the braggadocios lyrics, Drake flexes that he has a Visa Platinum Card which has an exceedingly high spending limit and greater purchasing power. As of a 2018 Forbes article, Drake is the fourth wealthiest hip-hop artist with over $100 million net worth.

Drake also links his Platinum card to his success in hip-hop, as each of his albums has garnered the Platinum certification or higher. Platinum certification means that an album has sold over 1,000,000 copies, which all his records have done besides his most recent May 2020 release Dark Lane Demo Tapes. As of June 2018, Drake has also become the highest certified digital singles artist, bringing in over 148 million equivalent units.

Drake also gives a shout to female artists Ariana Grande and Selena Gomez respectively who are both successful artists, with each of them going platinum.']]), ('Bodyguards don’t look like Kevin Costner, you tweakin’
 Just pulled up to Whitney Houston, Texas for the evenin’', [['This is a nod to the 1992 film The Bodyguard which stars Kevin Costner and Whitney Houston. It’s about a former Secret Service agent who goes on to protect a pop star who had been receiving threats.

Drake plays on Whitney’s last name with the city of the same name, which is located in Texas. Houston holds a special place in Drake’s heart as it was where he flew to meet Lil Wayne back in 2008 to kickstart his career. He also dedicated his February 2009 song “November 18th” to the city and has “Houston” tatted on his body.']])]

genius_description:
“Taki Taki” is a DJ Snake produced song influenced by Reggaeton, featuring a trio with Latin roots: Ozuna, Cardi B and Selena Gomez, singing in both Spanish and English.

In the song, the artists talk about dancing and the possibility of how love could go much farther through dancing and teasing. Taki Taki has no official meaning, and it is believed that is used in the song just for better sound.

The rumors of this joint song first surfaced on 25 August 2018 when DJ Snake posted a photo on social media showing director stools for the four artists (plus Cardi’s daughter), teasing the collaboration between them.

https://twitter.com/djsnake/status/1033155101517479936

The song was confirmed to be about 6 minutes prior to its release. But in fact the song only lasts for 3:32 after the release. Whether the song has ever been 6 minutes long before may never be truly resolved.
genius_annotations:
[('Ouija board', [['The ouija, also known as a spirit board or talking board, is a flat board marked with the letters of the alphabet, the numbers 0–9,']]), ('This punani', [['The female genitalia.']]), ('He said he wanna to touch it, and tease it, and squeeze it
 Well, my piggy bank is hungry, my nigga, you need to feed it', [['Cardi takes a note out of her hustling past—performing sexual acts on men in exchange for money and materialistic items. After being fired from her job as a supermarket worker, Cardi took to stripping at 19 in order to escape domestic violence and earn the money needed to continue her education. Eventually, she joined the cast of Love & Hip Hop in 2015, where she carried her stripper identity and persona with her. In an episode, when asked “what is the craziest thing [she’s] used a man for,” Cardi responded:

You pay my rent for six months straight because you like me […] a lot of these men will tell you like “Listen, I got a wife but I wanna have a good time.” Oh, and I got bills, and I want them to be paid.

Cardi has rapped about her profit-focused attitude before, notably on her breakout hit, June 2017’s “Bodak Yellow”:

He wanna swim with his face, I’m like, “Okay”
I’ll let him get what he want, he buy me Yves Saint Laurent']]), ('Taki taki, quiere un besito o un ñaqui
 Booty explota como Nagasaki (-aki)
 Prende los motores Kawasaki (Kawasaki)
 Que la disco está llena y llegaron los Anunnakis (Eh-eh)', [['Español:
Un “ñaqui” significa un bocado pequeño o un pedacito. Ozuna le pone las opciones de un beso o de un pedazo de otra cosa.

Nagasaki es una ciudad Japón que es conocida por los ataques de bombas nucleares de Hiroshima y Nagasaki durante la Segunda Guerra Mundial. Ozuna dice que la “booty”, o nalga, es tan grande que va a explotar como esas bombas.

Kawasaki es una compañía de motocicletas y motores basada en Japón. Es conocida por sus motores poderosos que permiten altas velocidades.

Los Annunakis son un grupo de deidades de la mitología mesopotámica, los cuales son descritos como dioses menores. Ozuna quiere decir con esto que acaban de llegar los “mejores” a la discoteca.

  


English:

Do you want a kiss or a ñaqui
Booty blows up like Nagasaki
Turn on the Kawasaki motorcycles
That the club is full
And the Anunnakis are here

“Ñaqui” means a small bite or a little piece. Ozuna makes her choose between a kiss and piece of something else.

Nagasaki is a city in Japan that is known for the nuclear bomb attacks of Hiroshima and Nagasaki during the Second World War. Ozuna says that the booty is so big that is going to blow up like those bombs.

Kawasaki is a motorcycle and motor company based in Japan. It is known for its powerful engines that allow for high speeds.

The Annunakis are a group of deities of Mesopotamian mythology, which are described as minor gods. Ozuna means that the “best” have just arrived at the club.']]), ('I said, “We should have a date—where? At the Lamborghini store”', [["English:
Back in July, Cardi B took to her Instagram to show that she and her husband Offset got matching Lambo’s. They both got a Lamborghini Aventador.

Cardi later said that she got the car to take pics and rap about it, much like she did on “I Like It”:

Eating halal, driving the Lam'



  


Español:

Yo dije que deberíamos tener una cita, ¿donde? en una tienda de Lamborguinis

En julio, Cardi B en su Instagram mostró que ella y su esposo Offset se compraron carros Lamborghini idénticos. Ambos compraron un Lamborghini Aventador.

Cardi más tarde dijo que lo  compró para tomar fotos y cantar sobre el carro, como lo hizo en “I Like It”:

Comiendo halal, manejando un Lambo'"]]), ('Taki taki, taki taki, ¡rumba!', [['English:
Rumba is used as a synonym for “party” in many Latin American countries and since the 19th Century, it is also used to refer to the musical style that originated in Cuba, known as Cuban rumba. The genre involves dance, percussion and song.

Rumba is one of the most explicit and sensual of all the Latin dances due to its slow rhythms and hip movements. The dance is performed by a couple dancing in a box step, slowly and quickly repeating a pattern.

  


Español:
Rumba se utiliza como sinónimo de “fiesta” en muchos países de América Latina y desde el siglo XIX, también se utiliza para referirse al estilo musical que se originó en Cuba, conocido como la rumba cubana. El género incluye baile, percusión y canción.

La rumba es uno de los bailes latinos más explícitos y sensuales debido a sus ritmos lentos y movimientos de cadera. El baile es realizado por una pareja que baila en cercanía, repitiendo lenta y rápidamente un patrón.']]), ('Hi Music Hi Flow', [['English:
Hi Music Hi Flow is a producer who collaborates frequently with Ozuna. They have worked together since the beginning of Ozuna’s career and among their most recognizable songs are  “Única” and “Se Preparo”.

Hi Music Hi Flow also has producer credits on this song.

  


Español:
Hi Music Hi Flow es un productor que colabora frecuentemente con  Ozuna. Han trabajado juntos desde los inicios de la carrera de Ozuna y entre sus temas más reconocidos están “Única” y “Se Preparó”.

Hi Music Hi Flow también tiene créditos de productor en esta canción.']])]

genius_description:
“NO DRIBBLE” is a promotional single for Baby & Stunna’s upcoming mixtape, and also appeared on the deluxe to Baby’s BLAME IT ON BABY.

A music video was released alongside the track just a few hours later.
genius_annotations:
[('Still in the field like a taxi (Uh)', [['Correction:

“Still in the field like a Texan”']]), ('I’m having checks on me, nigga, I’m Nike', [['Nike is a clothing brand best known for their footwear. They are also well known for their trademark logo, which consists of a simple “swoosh.” However, it is more often referred to as a check.']]), ('I pull up with two hundred ’bows in my rental (Go, go, go)', [['DaBaby quoted a similar on his July 2019 Lil Baby-assisted track “Baby,” where he rapped:

Huh? Baby prolly still got them ‘bows

He quoted another similar bar on his January 2017 remix of Drake’s track “Fake Love”:

We take them pounds and stuff ‘em in a rental']]), ('Broke nigga unemployed, the nigga Tommy', [['DaBaby makes a reference to Thomas Mikal Ford’s character Tommy Strawn from the series Martin which ran from 1992 to 1997. Throughout the series there was a long running joke that Tommy never worked or had a job.']]), ('I give her dick, she walk out like it’s Thriller (Yeah)', [['In this line, DaBaby references the zombies in Michael Jackson’s hit 1982 music video Thriller suggesting that women will be physically impaired after having sex with him.']]), ('We fill him with lead, he a pencil (Fill him up)', [['This is referring to bullets being made of lead, and them “filling you up”, when you get shot. The second half of this is referring to how pencils also use lead for writing.']]), ('I’ma shoot at a nigga, no dribble (Go)', [['DaBaby is relating the shooting of a gun with the shooting of a basketball into the basket.

This is why he says ‘no dribble’ since dribble is a basketball term.



He also means that he is not gonna waste any time or stall in shooting you, just like he is not wasting time dribbling and instead, going directly for the shot in basketball.']])]

genius_description:
“Con Calma” es una adaptación de la canción “Informer”, grabada en el 1992 por el rapero canadiense Snow.

La versión original trata de como delataron y arrestaron a Snow ante la policía por supuestamente haber cometido delitos de robo y homicidio, siendo “Informer” un desahogo que Snow escribió estando en prisión.

En esta nueva versión, la canción ha sido adaptada al ritmo urbano para hablar de como un hombre se ve atraído hacia una mujer en la discoteca, una temática muy común en los temas actuales de reggaetón; sin embargo, se conservó un verso de la canción original, para que no se pierda la esencia que caracterizaba a “Informer”.
genius_annotations:
[('[Verso 3: Snow & Daddy Yankee]', [["Este verso fue el mismo que Snow utilizó en su canción “Informer”, a la que “Con Calma” le hace un remix y homenaje.

El único cambio hecho en este verso es en la última línea, cambiando la palabra “daddy” por “Daddy Yankee”, dejando al artista como el nuevo protagonista del verso. Esta es la línea original de “Informer”:

Yes-a daddy me Snow me-a go reachin' out da top, so.

Y fue cambiada por:

Yes-a Daddy Yankee me-a go reachin' out da top, so."]])]

genius_description:
Danileigh throws a few curveballs, occasionally straying from the upbeat dance-friendly tracks she’s been spewing to slow it down on cuts like the one in question: “Easy.”

Produced by Christopher Allen Clark and Fallon King, “Easy” is a display of a more delicate side of DaniLeigh as moody backdrop gives way to romantic undertones as Dani gently releases: “Make you feel lucky, lucky/Make you wanna love me, love me/Baby, when you with me, with me/Got no worries, worries.”

genius_description:
Despite not being released as an official single until the song was sent to radio months after release, “Say So” gained the most traction from Doja Cat’s sophomore album Hot Pink. This is mainly due to users on the popular video-sharing platform, TikTok, uploading videos of themselves dancing to it. Her August 2018 track “MOOO!” and March 2019’s “Juicy” had also achieved similar success on the platform.

On the upbeat R&B dance-inspired track, Doja sings about wanting her friend to stop “beating ‘round the bush” and confess their love to her. Because of a slight mix-up in the chorus of the song during its transcription on Genius, a small frenzy started on Twitter, with many fans thinking that Doja was singing “I get you hot and moaning.” This was later then cleared up by Doja after she tweeted the official lyrics on December 27, 2019, more than 7 weeks after its release.
genius_annotations:
[('And we can dance all day around it
 If you frontin’, I’ll be bouncing', [["A few definitions for those that don’t understand the language here.

“Dancing around it” is a common English expression that means to avoid discussing something or avoid dealing with it directly.

“Frontin'” refers to putting up a façade, to be faking it.

To be “bouncin'” / to “bounce” in this situation means to leave the room/area.

The entire first verse is Doja admitting she’s into this guy to herself, whilst knowing he’s into her too. But the guy hasn’t made a move yet. Doja likes him, but if he’s faking it, she’s not gonna deal with it. She has no time for playing games."]])]

genius_description:
“HAD ENOUGH” features Don Toliver and Migos members Quavo and Offset discussing their relationship with a girl who is done with them due to their past transgressions.

The track was leaked online in April 2019 before seeing its official release in December of that year as part of the JACKBOYS compilation.

“HAD ENOUGH” is also featured as the ninth track on Don Toliver’s debut studio album HEAVEN OR HELL.
genius_annotations:
[('The rock on her finger dyslexic (Stupid)', [['Offset is serving luxury in this bar, with the diamond jewelry on her finger, shining bright and heavy in weight. The ring jewelry in question is expensive. Obviously.']]), ('Take off your gown and your dress (Take it off)
 She got C-cup, D-cup breast (D-cup)', [['Offset is alluding to Cardi B’s silicone breasts, which seems to be in constant evolvement. He’s also implementing his “addiction” to sex, and the heat that comes when the sexual intercourse has begun.']]), ('You got two choices, either Heaven or Hell, huh', [['On these lines, Don states that this girl has only two options, which is either staying with him or leaving and facing hell on earth.

This track is also included on his first studio album, HEAVEN OR HELL, so this might be a  simple reference to the title and it’s concept. Also, when “HAD ENOUGH” dropped, we didn’t know the title at the time, so it probably was a try to give us some kind of hint about it.']]), ('Know you had enough, we drink like Vikings (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, Purple)', [['Quavo is referring to drinking lean, a purple beverage which contains the drug codeine. Vikings have a reputation for drinking plenty of alcohol, and the purple color of lean matches the color scheme of the Minnesota Vikings.']]), ('Overload on Chanel it make her weep (Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, make her weep)', [['Coco Chanel was the founder of her eponymous luxury brand. However, Chanel and Coco are both names for the brand and for cocaine.



This phrase could mean that Quavo will either buy her a great number of luxury goods, or they would near overdose on cocaine, or even both.

Upon receiving these gifts, Quavo may be stating that this person would cry tears of joy or ‘weep’ elsewhere…']]), ('Shawty get wet like baguettes (Baguettes)', [['Offset uses the term baguette to refer to a type of cut applied to diamonds, resulting in a rectangular shape.



Diamonds are also often referred to as “water”, as Offset is making a parallel between the amount of lubrication his girl gets from sexual arousal and the jewelry he’s wearing, which is usually a lot.']]), ('(8)', [['This is the producer tag of Atlantan native, TM88. TM is a member of 808 Mafia, a collective compiled of multi-talented producers and songwriters.

This producer tag is a sample of 808 Mafia’s own collective tag, being a pitched-up and sped-up alternate of the original.

https://www.youtube.com/embed/-LHtEvpY2_I?start=0&end=6']]), ('Spike Lee, do the right thing (Right)', [['A reference to 1989 film written, directed, produced, and starring  African-American director, Spike Lee, Do the Right Thing, which is regarded by critics and fans as one of the best films ever made.']]), ('Know you had enough (What?)
 Lookin’ like what the fuck (Who?)
 You can’t trust, you think I’m in love with lust (Ooh)
 She look possessed, go and get it off your chest (Hey)
 She asked to read my texts (Texts)
 Lookin’ in her eyes, she stressed (Stressed)', [['Offset could be alluding to the consequences of infidelity on his wife, Cardi B. In December of 2018, rumors of Offset’s unfaithfulness were confirmed in an apology video from his mistress, the model Summer Bunni. The video’s release led Cardi to publicly split and seek a divorce from Offset.

https://twitter.com/OffsetYRN/status/1071837090512543746

While the two would soon after call off divorce, Offset has not remained immune from additional cheating accusations. A December 2019 social media hack appeared to indicate a connection between Offset and Tekashi 6ix9ine’s girlfriend.

As new rumors have continued to circulate, Offset here could be indicating Cardi’s resulting anxiety and requests to see his messages. In an interview with  Vogue, Cardi indicated the ongoing efforts to improve their marriage:

When me and my husband got into our issues—you know, he cheated and everything—and I decided to stay with him and work together with him']]), ('It’s a rodeo, go on and touch your toes (Touch your toes)', [['Toliver references Travis Scott’s debut album, Rodeo. Don Toliver and Travis have collaborated before, on the track, “Can’t Say.”

Scott has also shown Toliver love multiple times, including a cosign on Twitter.

https://twitter.com/trvisXX/status/1025237949535936517?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1025237949535936517&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fgenius.com%2Falbums%2FDon-toliver%2FDonny-womack

The second half of the line cleverly alludes to a sexual position that Toliver wants his girl to get into.']])]

genius_description:
“Desires” is Drake and Future’s second collaboration of 2020, following January’s “Life Is Good.”

On August 29, 2019, Future teased a snippet of this track via his Instagram Story. On December 20, 2019, a second snippet surfaced online. A demo of the song, thought to be titled “I Know,” was leaked on January 4, 2020.

On January 31, 2020, an official version of the track was released on the OVO SoundCloud page. The official version featured two additional verses from Drake. The track appeared under the title “DESIRES LEAK 2020 SUPER FUTURE DRAKE,” indicating that Drake and Future were aware of the demo’s leak.

The song was eventually placed on Drake’s fifth mixtape, Dark Lane Demo Tapes.
genius_annotations:
[('I’m in that 8 and that 1 and that 2, this a different Ferrari, yeah', [['This is a nod to the Ferrari 812, although there are two versions—the Superfast and its convertible version, the GTS. The 812 Superfast, which made its debut at the 2017 Geneva Motor Show, carries a base MSRP of $335,275 and has a top speed of 211 mph—making it the fastest and most powerful of all Ferrari models.

The 812 GTS, on the other hand, features the same performance as the Superfast. The only difference is a slightly adjusted design, weight, price, and the inclusion of a V12 engine—the first convertible model offered by Ferrari in 50 years that has one.



The 812 GTS']]), ('I should’ve put you somewhere where no one could find you
 Mansion out in the sticks with nothin’ around you
 Katy, Texas, Dallas, Texas, you know, a different environment (Ayy)', [['The phrase “out in the sticks” is used to describe a location out in the middle of nowhere, typically in the country or on the outskirts of a city.

The city of Katy, Texas is located directly west of the city of Houston and considered a part of the Greater Houston metropolis. In the 1960s, local land developers began to develop neighborhoods and suburban communities throughout Katy, due to the overgrowing population in Houston. Today, communities in Katy, south of I-10, are predominantly upper-middle class, in which mansions and golf courses are not uncommon. The I-10 corridor, a major highway that runs through the city of Houston, passes through Katy, which makes it convenient for residents to access Houston’s Downtown district.



Drake appears to believe Katy would have been a better location for his girl to live, since it’s further away from the trouble, temptations, or influences that seem to exist for his girl in Houston. Drake even goes as far as to consider the city of Dallas, the third most populated city in the state of Texas, and four hours away of Houston, as another possible home for his girl. Since Dallas has several areas of luxurious housing as well, it could be a comfortable place for his girl to live, and more importantly, away from Houston, as far as the rapper is concerned.



Downtown Dallas']]), ('And you just wanna hear some chune, some music
 I think, you know, you found the right spot', [['“Chune” is the Jamaican Patois pronunciation of the word “tune,” which is used to refer to a song. Drake used the term on his March 2017 song, “Free Smoke”:

And more chune for your headtop
So watch how you speak on my name, you know?']]), ('I’m outside in an AMG
 Right outside, TT', [['In this audio recording, Drake is singing the lyrics to “Time Flies,” which is the next song on the mixtape, so this creates a seamless segue.']]), ('I was too good to you, should’ve stayed solid', [['Drake feels as if he’s been taken for granted by this girl. On his April 2016 song “Too Good,” he sang about the same thing:

I’m too good to you
I’m way too good to you
You take my love for granted
I just don’t understand it']]), ('Ayy
 Self-control has never been your thing
 Don’t think it’ll help if there’s a ring with a rock in it', [['Drake doesn’t think marrying this girl will solve their relationship problems. On the other hand, he has expressed interest in marriage—a source close to Drake told Hollywood Life in 2017 Drake’s marriage plans once he finds the right girl:

Drake does want to settle down and have kids one day, and he’s confident that the right woman will come along at the right time. Until then, Drake’s not forcing anything, and he’s making the most of the lifestyle that comes along with being Drake.']]), ('You had me down on my knees every day, had to talk with Messiah', [['In the Bible, Messiah was the name prophesied in the Old Testament to describe the coming King to redeem the people of Israel, Jesus Christ. For example, John 4:25 reads:

The woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.

On his 2012 song “Future Back,” Future also talked about praying to the Messiah:

I pray to Messiah, told him, “I want it all
Put me in the game, or I crawl behind the wall”']]), ('D. Hill (D. Hill)', [['This is D. Hill’s producer tag. It first made an appearance on Yung Mal’s January 2018 song, “GodZilla.”

This is his second collaboration with Drake and Future following “Life Is Good”—released three weeks prior to this song.']]), ('How the fuck you keep so many secrets?', [['Drake is not a fan of his significant other keeping secrets from him as he noted on his June 2010 song, “Karaoke”:

I tried to keep us together, you were busy keeping secrets
Secrets you were telling everybody but me']]), ('Got you a whip, but then you got back on your shit
 I had to tell Eric go get it', [['Drake may be talking about DJ Eric, a radio and strip club DJ from Houston. Drake and Eric are friends—for instance, in October 2017, Drake called in his radio show on his birthday and in July 2017, Drake posted a picture of Eric on his Instagram account.

https://www.instagram.com/p/BW3210iDuLO/?utm_source=ig_embed']])]

genius_description:
“Chicago Freestyle” released simultaneously with Drizzy’s “When To Say When.” Drake dedicates his lyrics to the lessons he learned on his come-up and reflects on the various mistakes he made in his past relationships.

The song came about as Giveon was on tour with Snoh Aalegra and decided to make a freestyle for every city he visited, hence “Chicago Freestyle”. The title’s usage may or may not be a reference to Drake’s AM/PM series as a result, which contains similar elements. This would mark Drizzy’s first addition to the mini grouping since June 2016’s “4PM in Calabasas,” as he continues to revisit his past and focuses on lyricism. It is likely that Drizzy recorded the single in the “Windy City,” as his AM/PM series typically were named based on location.

The track was officially released to streaming services on May 1, 2020 as part of Dark Lane Demo Tapes.
genius_annotations:
[('Hit another one, it goes green
 Must’ve changed phones on the team
 ’Member when you let me in between
 That was 2017', [['Drake uses an iPhone, any message sent from iPhone to a non-apple device will show up as green, instead of the iPhone to iPhone blue. If it was blue, now its green, this person probably either switched numbers or upgraded phones, thus ‘changed phone on the team’.



Simultaneously, Drake could be referencing his 2017 song “Free Smoke,” where he said:

I drunk text J-Lo
Old number, so it bounce back']]), ('Shower up and then we hit the club', [["In his 2011 Complex cover story, Drake told the interviewer that he would have liked to do the interview at his apartment but he was getting installed the most luxurious addition to his bathroom: “an experience shower”.

It’s a shower that’s lit by all LED lights. It has 10 jets, an overhead, and it sprays out lavender or whatever scents you want. It’s something I’ve always wanted.

His Toronto mansion, designed by Ferris Rafauli, has a huge tub with a skylight above, along with two rooftop terrace areas with an outdoor hot tub that offers guests to soak their feet in.



Drake's 4,000 lbs marble bathtub (est. worth around $30,000-$50,000)."]]), ('All good, Chubbs will look around
 Find one that seem my type
 That my dawg and he know what I like
 He done found me plenty in my life', [['Drake is referring to his close friend and head of security Nessel Beezer, who mainly goes by the alias “Chubbs” or “OVO Chubbs”.

In these few lines, Drake explains how Chubbs has been able to come across plenty of women that Drake finds attractive.']]), ('Problem is, I meet a girl tonight
 Then I go and treat her too nice
 Galleria credit card swipes
 I don’t even know if she a wife', [['Galleria is an upscale mall in Houston, TX, a city where Drake frequently raps about and visits.

Drake is saying he is too nice to women who may just be using him for his fame and wealth. Hence why they are using his credit card at malls to shop even though he doesn’t know if they could ever be his wife or if they’re a wife to someone else.']]), ('Pistol on J for survival
 Lot of people gunnin’ for the title', [['In these lines, Drake first states and refers to his person security carrying a gun for his protection.

In the next line, he uses the previous to execute his punchline about other rappers who are out overtake him in the music industry. There are many people who are out to get Drake knocked off his perch at the top of the music industry, and potentially also want him dead. We know that Drake his people who want him dead from the line in his song “Mob Ties” from his 2018 Scorpion Album:

They want me gone but dont know why

Also from his lyrics in “I’m Upset”. a single from the album Scorpion, where Drake, in different parts of the song raps these lyrics:

Fifty thousand on my head, its disrespect
Hunnid thousand on my head, its disrespect and also
Half a million on my head I can accept']]), ('AMEX had a limit in the past
 I had plenty women in the past
 I done plenty sinnin’ in the past
 You don’t need to know, but you can ask', [['Reminiscing about previous times, Drake reflects on changes in affection and financial circumstances. Addressing his current love interest, he highlights plenty of former relationships despite spending limits on his AMEX or American Express credit card.

For most consumers, credit card companies impose limits on the amount that one can spend each month. As a product of his established wealth, Drake has since moved on to the infamous American Express Centurion “black card,” an invitation-only charge card with no spending limits.

Moving to the present, Drake finds perspective in examining past financial challenges but does not seek to detail misdeeds from lost love.']]), ('But I do know one thing though
 Women, they come they go
 Saturday through Sunday, Monday
 Monday through Sunday, yo
 Maybe I’ll love you one day
 Maybe we’ll someday grow
 ’Til then, I’ll sit my drunk ass on that runway
 On this one way', [['Drake pays tribute to Eminem by interpolating his May 2002 song “Superman” but with slightly changed lyrics:

But I do know one thing though
Bitches, they come, they go
Saturday through Sunday, Monday
Monday through Sunday, yo
Maybe I’ll love you one day
Maybe we’ll someday grow
‘Til then just sit your drunk ass on that fuckin’ runway, ho

In Eminem’s song, he takes a very aggressive tone. “Superman” was written in the wake of Eminem’s divorce and his falling out with Mariah Carey, with whom he allegedly had a brief relationship. In the chorus, Eminem is speaking to his admirer, who is likely Mariah, and he reminds the woman that she is dispensable. If she acts out, there are plenty of women in line that are ready to take her place.

In contrast, Drake’s interpretation of the lyrics is melancholic. He has grown tired of quick relationships and is looking for something more serious, but his current lifestyle makes that impossible. In Drake’s version, the “runway” is an airport runway, where he has boarded a one-way flight to his next show.']]), ('Two-thirty, baby, won’t you meet me by The Bean?', [['In accordance with the track’s title, Giveon drops multiple iconic characteristics of the track’s titular city.

Firstly, Cloud Gate, known by its popular name “The Chicago Bean,” is a public art sculpture designed by Indian-British sculptor Anish Kapoor that was first unveiled in 2004 in Millennium Park, Chicago. The sculpture has become an iconic piece of Chicago and is one of the most popular tourist locations in the city.



Secondly, Chicago’s nickname is “The Windy City.” While this nickname is usually attributed to Chicago’s freezing cold temperatures due to the winds coming from Lake Michigan, the name is thought to have been  actually derived in the 1800s with politicians in the city blowing “hot air,” which is a saying for spewing lots of words without any actual substance.']])]

genius_description:
“Pain 1993” is a nod to fashion designer Ian Connor’s motto,  “Born from Pain 1993.” Ian is a longtime friend of Drake and Carti and he was previously Carti’s manager. Carti even named a song after him in 2015.

The track was revealed on June 7, 2019, by Ian on Twitter in a screenshot reading “Drake x Carti – ‘Pain 1993’ Noel Ref 1,“ with "Noel” indicating that it was engineered by OVO Noel and “Ref 1” indicating that it is the first reference of the track.

Snippets of Drake’s vocals in the reference were leaked in January 2020. Drake previewed his chorus and verse in full on April 7, 2020, on Instagram Live, asking his fans to tell Carti to release it.

On April 16, 2020, a promotional video recorded by Ian Connor and Chris Skylark and edited by Nick Dolan was previewed on the Born from Pain Twitter, also previewing the chorus and most of Drake’s verse in full quality.

On April 29, 2020, Ian Connor posted a text message from Drake reading “So proud / Pain 1993 came to life” on Twitter, implying that Carti recorded a verse for the song. The next day, the song surfaced on Shazam showing that it was given back to Drake and would be released on Dark Lane Demo Tapes.

Drake confirmed its appearance on the project two hours later on Instagram. Snippets of the full song surfaced a few hours before its release.
genius_annotations:
[('Niggas ain’t gotta respect
 Niggas just gotta accept
 I put that top left', [['“Top left” is Toronto slang for telling the truth. On Dark Lane Demo Tapes‘ eleventh track “Losses,” Drake proclaims his lyrics are “cold facts”:

I’m not tryna make no song, these are cold facts']]), ('Police in my city, man, I keep they pockets greased up (Okay)', [["“I keep they pockets greased up” means Drake has dirty cops working for him under his payroll. While he doesn’t mind cops working for him, Drake wouldn’t work with them—on September 2013’s “Worst Behavior,” he rapped about not telling the police anything whenever they’d asked him questions:

But your shit is like the police askin' us questions
Nigga, we don’t know shit

A similar sentiment followed on his February 2015 song, “No Tellin’”:

Yeah, police comin' ‘round lookin’ for some help
On a case they gotta solve, we never help ‘em"]]), ('Used to be an antisocial nigga, now I’m makin’ friends', [["When someone is antisocial, they’re not sociable or unable to associate themselves with other people.

Earlier in his career, Drake often rapped about not making friends and avoiding fake friends—for example, on his February 2013 song “Started From The Bottom,” he raps:

No new niggas, nigga, we don’t feel that
Fuck a fake friend, where your real friends at?
We don’t like to do too much explainin'
Story stayed the same, I never changed it"]]), ('Diamonds all in my teeth, I called up the dentist, yeah (Okay)', [['Playboi Carti has a custom 14 karat white gold top and bottom grill set, which was made by custom jewelers, IF & Co. He mentioned his grills before on his May 2018 song, “Right Now”:

All these diamonds in my teeth, I had to smile (Cash, cash)']]), ('Every time I’m home, you know I whip the Bentley (Yeah, yeah, yeah)', [["Bentley is a luxury British car manufacturer that’s known for its high-quality SUVs. Carti rapped about a Bentley before on his March 2017 song, ​“wokeuplikethis*”:

Fuck me, Bentley coupe I’m ridin' with a thottie, fuck

He also rapped about one on his April 2017 song, “Location”:

You cannot hop in my car (Yeah, yeah)
Bentley coupe ridin' with stars (Yeah, yeah)"]]), ('Got a Goyard bag, I threw them racks in it (My racks, yeah)', [['Goyard is an expensive French brand that sells luxury travel trunks and leather goods, such as bags and briefcases. Carti’s a big fan of the brand—he rapped about it on his April 2017 song “Had 2”

Goyard ‘round my waist and it hold the Glock, ooh

He also rapped about it on his unreleased cut “Goku”:

Goyard, I done did it']]), ('Now every day I rock Christian Dior (Okay, Dior, yeah)', [["Christian Dior is a French luxury goods company with distinct designs. Carti has previously shouted out the luxury brand before, like on his leaked track “Butterfly Doors”, where he raps:

Rockin' that Christian Dior
I had to mop up the floors (What?)"]]), ('Racks all in my jeans and they Raf Simons (Racks in my jeans, okay)', [['Raf Simons is a luxury menswear label that was founded in 1995 by Belgian fashion designer Raf Simons. Notably, Carti featured on the May 2017 A$AP Mob posse-cut “RAF,” a song dedicated to the label.



Carti pictured with Gucci Mane wearing Raf Simons in 2017']]), ('That Lam’ truck got numbers on the board (Okay, get it)', [['Carti is referring to the Lamborghini Urus, a large model vehicle offered from the Italian car manufacturer. At high speed, the car’s odometer shows high numbers in the front.

This is the first time Carti has mentioned the Italian brand since he was pulled over in the vehicle for an expired tag, which led to his arrest.

Interestingly, Carti has openly mocked Lamb trucks, as he posted this photo in 2018, showing off the Lamborghini coupe that girlfriend Iggy Azalea bought him for Christmas.']]), ('Me and Capo tryna leave our mark and peace the East up
 Ain’t nobody makin’ too much money off the beef stuff (Okay)', [["Drake has given a shout-out to “Capo” several times, most notably on “Look Alive”:

They won’t be expectin' shit when Capo go to slide (Hah)

Capo could refer to a close friend and associate of Halal Gang: a Toronto hip-hop collective comprised of rappers Puffy L’z,  Mo-G, SAFE, and the now-deceased Smoke Dawg. Drake has some history with the group, cosigning them in 2015 by posting the track “Still” – famous for popularizing the “Ginobili dance”. While Drake was later involved in a minor beef with the group, the line about patching up beef may hint at it being squashed.

It is also possible that Capo actually refers to Chubbs, Drakes head of security, right handman, and “fixer”. Drake has directly referred to him as Capo in the past. In Mafia terminology, a capo is often the head of a specialized crew, who gets his orders directly from the family’s (under)boss(es)."]])]
